Reviews.Title: Awesome design and quality
Reviews.Author: H. Hristov "HKH"
Reviews.Content: I just received my DSC-TX20 (Black) yesterday and I've tested it and compared it to the previous DSC-TX10 that I had for one year and I gave it to my brother in law. I've been very happy with the DSC-TX10 and I like the new DSC-TX20 a lot. There is no significant changes, the main ones are that the shooter speed is increased to 4 sec (from 2 sec) for night shooting and the new one has video recording in 60i in 1080 AVCHD. Also the panorama option has been boosted since the DSC-TX10's entry, offering solid panoramas of up to 360 degrees. Sony also increased focusing speed. I think these are basically all the differences. Waterproofing and the design hasn't change at all. I red a lot of comments about the waterproofing on the TX10 - both good and bed. I am scuba diver and I've been doing underwater photography for several years now. This camera is not designed for that, it's rated only for 5 meters (16 foot) which I tested in our community pool and it works just fine. Of course you will need to read the instructions and make sure that the seals are properly closed. The camera is great for any pool and for a lot of fun with the kids. Bottom line - it's awesome camera. For it's class I think it's the best on the market for now. If you are looking for very good pictures from a small camera - that's the one.I recommend you also read the professional review for this model at [[...]]

Reviews.Title: Nice camera. Best-in-class picture quality
Reviews.Author: Tech-Guru
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after trying (and being disappointed with) the Nikon Coolpix. The picture quality from the Sony camera was light-years better than the Nikon.The "good":Very small.The moveable metal cover did a good job protecting the lens, and was easy to open with one hand.Superb picture quality and superb videos16Megapix qualityA good zoom featureThe "bad"Pricey (most expensive in its class?)The record, on/off, display, picture buttons are all WAY TOO CLOSE TO EACH OTHER...It is sometimes hard to press just the button you wantThe documentation is not great (the documentation is stored electronically in the camera and is not very comprehensiveThe lens is located very close to the top-left of the camera and your finger will make its way into too many of your photosThe electronic viewfinder is difficult to see in bright sunlight (all cameras that have a similar viewfinder will have this problem)Having said this, I'm glad I bought it and pleased with the quality and the product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera!!
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: We've had this little guy through a Maui vacation, and it's been excellent!!First off, some good points:It's certainly waterproof, and has a "underwater" scene mode to help you shoot underwater. I'm not exactly sure what it does, but it seems to work better underwater with the underwater mode enabled, the auto mode tends to kick the camera into Macro mode underwater.We've taken it snorkeling with us, as well as played in the waves and surf with it and it worked excellently. You can see the screen while snorkeling without too many issues, the camera does have a touchscreen, and it automatically disables the touchscreen while under water. This does mean that you're limited to changing settings while you're above water, but you can start and stop video recording as well as take pictures, zoom, and turn the camera on and off without the touchscreen.The built in panorama mode is pretty great, it reminds me of the panorama mode in iOS 6, works basically the same way, turn your camera vertically and move it smoothly and quickly from one side to the other.The image quality is excellent for what it is, the image sensor is a actual CMOS sensor (albeit still a small one) both "dry land" photos and underwater photos turn out great. I normally shoot with a DSLR and good lenses so impressing me with a point-n-shoot has always been difficult.The video quality is excellent as well, I haven't viewed any of it on the HDTV yet but viewing them on the built in LCD they've been great.It also takes standard SD cards as well, which since it's a Sony device is for sure a plus.The waterproof doors that cover the battery/sd card and the HDMI / USB port both have indicators to indicate that they're closed completely, hopefully to help avoid improperly latched doors.The charger is just a USB port on a wall socket, this means that you can charge the camera in the car with a 12V to USB adapter, like the ones used to charge cell phones.Some Drawbacks:As I mentioned earlier, the touchscreen is useless when you're swimming or snorkeling with it, which means adjusting the settings isn't possible during your underwater excursions.The sliding lens cover can get dirt/sand trapped under it, but if you keep aware of it and rinse it out it doesn't seem to cause any issues. Also the instructions recommend rinsing the camera out with fresh water if you use it in salt water.The USB cable isn't a standard micro USB plug, in fact I have no idea what plug it is, I've only seen it once on this camera. That means that if you lose your USB cable, charging the camera isn't going to be possible.Battery life isn't super long, using it for most of the day brought the battery down to the half range. But since you can charge it off of any USB port, we charge it in the car.The camera body its self is made of aluminum and isn't rubberized like most waterproof cameras, this means that the aluminum could get scratched or dented. However this hasn't happened to mine yet.Bottom Line:The bottom line is, that this is an excellent durable camera that is also waterproof! It's a solid investment if you're traveling or in need of something waterproof!

Reviews.Title: And here's why I stick to Sony.
Reviews.Author: Harkanwar Anand
Reviews.Content: I don't use SLR cameras because they are too much to carry around and I am a little shy. I need a camera which is better than an SLR and if my ignorance can be ignored i dare say, this camera for what it's worth is better than buying an SLR for your travler, photo enthusiast, keen spirit hippie tree lover. Two years back I tried Canon for digital cameras. They make some amazing ultra compact slick scratch free easy to use cameras and I was immediately a fan. Those cameras would cost around $200 and the battery life was decent enough. My cousin visited me from India and we went to Vegas, Georgia and Orlando and all this while we used his Sony Camera. I was so impressed I decided to buy the Sony TX 10 (previous model of the camera you're reading about) and the relationship was beautiful.When I lost my waterproof TX10, I was very sad because it was easily the best camera I had owned. It's amazing how much money we spend on traveling but seldom do we realize the value of spending $100 more for a camera that will go the extra 20 miles and give you the best output. I paid $320 for mine when I was in Shenzhen, China.Features -a) Image quality in low light is superior without any defacing. More sharp than the TX 10.b) The interface has changed since the previous camera and it took me a few days to get used toc) 16.2 Megapixel camera and videos are shot very welld) nice big led display / touchscreen works goode) Strong Battery - Easily click 300 + images before requiring recharge / plenty of options to view/playback meanwhilef) Slick design though almost no change since TX 10g) 100 % waterproof .. i have tried it a loth) This can take a few shocks and falls tooPros -a) The image itself is superior to any entry level or mid level Canon cameras and the design is also much coolerb) The image capture team seems oddly a fraction of a second longer than the TX 10 sometimes but this also ensures no blurriness whatsoeverc) Super flash. It will make you look good and the objects in the background sustain themselves tood) Easy to put in pockete) Very fast load time and hardly any lag.Cons -a) No extra battery charger and you have to charge by connecting into power socketb) Sony Memory Stick Duo Pro doesn't play on my iMac or Macbook Air / I have to connect usb cable which is a chorec) Interface will take slightly longer to get used to and the button that makes images turn left to make horizontal/vertical is very buggy and ineffective (it's a touchscreen button)d) I have a scratch on this within 20 days. I must have kept it in a pocket with change or pen or something. The screen should be able to take more.I am never buying anything but Sony for cameras. Don't quote me on this but I believe the iPhone 4s uses a Sony/Carl Zeiss lens.I love this camera and I pray I don't lose I lost my last TX 10.***PS - I visited China recently and am uploading a few images, please do check for quality***

Reviews.Title: Big pictures in a small package
Reviews.Author: D. Rutherford "Brokenboat"
Reviews.Content: I am a, more or less, forensic photographer.  That is to say, that I use my camera for work in the field of marine accident investigation.  Sure, I have the Nikon D700 and a myriad of lenses and flash units, but to be honest, the camera I pull out most is the DSC TX20.  this is a replacement model for me.  I used the DSC TX10 (I think that is what it was) for a long time.  This camera was, at first a slight disappointment because when I took it out of the box, I realized that the screen was smaller than on my old one.  I had to adjust.  No big deal.  The photos are nothing short of amazing.  I shoot in many dark scenes and enclosed spaces and the flash is so well balanced, I get better results than with the D700.  What I love the most, and relish, is the macro.  This camera gets into small spaces.  I can hold the lens far less than 1/2" away from the subject and get a tight, high resolution photos that, frankly, blows away my Nikkor 105 macro lens that costs more than 4 times what this camera costs.  Drawbacks: Small and light weight is not always good in a camera.  Steadying the camera becomes a bit of a challenge sometimes as a result.  If you work in a dirty environment, the slide front is subject to getting dirt under the edge and the screen is subject to scratches and smudges.  I uses a Blackberry phone holster with mine and it is always by my side.

Reviews.Title: Great...But
Reviews.Author: Bryan P Peroni
Reviews.Content: I love the size and features of this camera. I just took it on a trip to Belize where we snorkeled. The little Sony was terrific. It good picture and videos that we certainly acceptable or better for its size. It was really nice to be able to always have it in my pocket for a quick shot.Unfortunately, when I got home I notice what appeared to be some green corrosion on the mini HDMI connector. Sure enough when I tried to view my pictures and video on my TV it was a no go. Everything else is working fine but it is a real bummer that the HD video, 3D images, etc... only work through the HDMI, so back to Sony it must go since I was 3 days beyond the Amazon returns policy :-(So far the Sony returns process seems OK so hopefully I will get a new or at least working unit to have fun with on my next excursion.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Cougarbait33
Reviews.Content: After a 20 mile, 3 day whitewater kayaking trip in the back country of the Big South Fork Nat'l River & Recreation Area, I can say that I have pretty thoroughly testing this little camera and I love it.  Sand, mud, dirt, etc. can get in behind the sliding cover, which will cause scratches if you don't clean it properly.  Instructions are provided, and submerging in clean water for 5 minutes effectively cleared the grit.  It is VERY small, which I love for portability, but I can see how it would be cumbersome for folks that are "all thumbs".  Photo & video quality are great for such a compact, waterproof camera, and in full auto mode it does a good job with metering and exposure.  Obviously, there are loads of point and shoot cameras that will take better photos, but for me this is a beach/river/back country camera for those times when it isn't practical to bring a better camera.  It has an awesome macro function that lets you get extremely close to your subject, and the auto-pano function works great and is really fun.  I'm still getting used to the idea of carrying a camera with me in my kayak and not obsessing about keeping it in a pelican case the whole time!  I highly recommend a floating camera strap to go with it in case you drop it in the water... it's water proof, not sink proof!  I snagged the chums camera strap and it works great.  I don't expect it to last forever, but I'm hard on gear and will happily put this little unit through hell until it gives up! :-)

Reviews.Title: UNSAFE AT ANY DEPTH--FAIL
Reviews.Author: Jammerjammer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after A LOT of research on the Web. Okay, it's a sickness, but I like to make sure I'm buying a solid machine if I can. Surprisingly, other companies that have been making these types of "Tough" cameras for much longer--companies like Olympus and Pentax--have pretty lousy track records overall. They cost a bunch, the pictures are soft, the video is SD or mono, and they're just not as tough as they need to be.Which is why I was skeptical about the TX20. It's smaller than those cameras, has more features and doesn't look "Tough." But review after review touted the camera's durability and performance. The stereo video and compact size is what sold me on the camera ultimately. That and the fact that it uses SD cards instead of those awful old memory sticks.So why get a Tough camera? Well, I wanted to get the shots I could never get before. Rainy shots. Underwater video. Pool park photos. There are so many places a Tough camera can go that you wouldn't take another camera. And even though the shots will be softer and less defined than most any other compact camera, a slightly soft shot is better than no shot at all. If you're looking for a "do-everything" camera, look elsewhere. I use this camera as a supplement to my serious compact and DSLR. Both of those get far better results, but neither can go underwater (without insanely expensive housings).First shots were impressive. The LCD is bright, which is great considering that it's usually very bright outside in water. Pics look great on the back of the camera--much less so on your monitor at home. The video and the stabilization is terrific for so small a camera. It is hands-down its best feature. That and the panorama stitch.So I took some shots in a pool, at a water park, in puddles. I tried to submerge the camera sparingly. I didn't, for example, place it in my swim trunks and swim around in it. I also never brought the camera down any lower than 2-3 feet in the water--I just didn't want to risk it. Things worked swimmingly for the first 3-4 outings. The flimsy outer door can get sand trapped in it, and you run the risk of scratches if that happens. It also traps water, making it hard to REALLY dry off the camera. And the battery SD card door doesn't inspire oceans of confidence in terms of feeling like there is a strong seal there. But, it seemed to be doing a fine job.So I put the camera on a shelf for 3-4 weeks, and went back to shoot it. The camera powered up, but there was nothing on the LCD--couldn't take a photo or video. After drying the camera out, and re-charging the battery--nothing. So I brought it into my local camera repair shop (it was out of warranty at this point). The camera had gotten water in the battery compartment and they had to disassemble, dry out the parts, replace a couple of fried parts, and re-assemble. $90 later, it was fixed.Now I have a repaired "Tough" camera that I have no confidence in. It lasted approximately ONE VACATION. And it's not a cheap camera. It's even more expensive when you sink $90 into a repair. The TX-10 is no different than the TX-20, and go and check THOSE reviews. You'll find lots of similar complaints. Bottom line, this camera is good at nothing else but shooting in and around water. Period. It's not a "take anywhere" camera. It's a pool camera. And if it can't do that, it's a paperweight. Sony needs to back up their claims, and review site testers need to put these cameras through far more rigorous testing than they currently do (dropping it in a tumbler of water? Really?). This camera is not tough, it's not durable, it takes the best pics and video of any current Tough Cam, but worse than any other non Tough Cam point and shoot. And it leaks. It leaks, it leaks, it leaks. Wait until someone really tests these tough cams thoroughly before buying. This market still needs work. Until then, buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera, 3D is hit or miss
Reviews.Author: Rick Myers
Reviews.Content: In short, its a great camera for your basic to enthusiast camera needs. I bought it to replace a TX5, and couldn't be happier with the improvement in function and feel.  It's a definite step up, and worth the money several times over.Now to the 3D.  First, I love 3D.  I have a 27inch 3D monitor and play my games in 3D.  We have a 73 inch 3D TV and up to twice a week it is movie night at our house for up to 8 guests, in full awesome 3D.  I am a 3D enthusiast.  I am *that* market niche.The camera bills itself as able to take breathtaking 3D stills and panoramas, and I will say that 50% of that statement is correct.  When taking 3D stills, you can hear the camera take two pictures.  On a scale of 1 to 10, the best 3D still I took had a "depth" value of about 3 (poor).  Most of the time, you really can't see the depth at all.  I tried far away... I tried up close (with a little better result up close)... it just doesn't seem to be worth it.  However...The panoramas are a different matter all together.  These get a solid 8-9 for 3D effect.  By moving the camera to create the panorama effect you get many different angles and perspectives on the scene you are looking at.  When the camera combines all of those images it creates the best 3D I have ever seen.  Better than most 3D movies, and it really did blow me away.When I want to take a 3D photo, I skip the still image photography and just do it as a panorama.  There's another mode which kind of sorta does a still image sized photo, but you take in the 'sweep your camera from left to right', so you end up with a still image aspect photo but taken in a panorama style method (if that makes sense).  Good results, but you get curious looks from people as in "what the heck are you doing swinging back and forth like that?"As a pure and simple camera, this camera is much improved over our TX-5, but you would expect that.  From what I have read, other cameras are credited with better pictures overall, but for form, fun factor, features, and price, you really can't go wrong with this camera.I do have one warning for people though.  As shipped, this camera is in a default mode that takes 12 megapixel photos.  You have to find the setting and up the photo to 16.2 MP for the best pictures.  Why they ship this camera in a mode other than its optimal I am not sure, but that may be one of the reasons this camera gets lower marks in overall photo quality than some competitors.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: KTLynn
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student, so I placed a great deal of thought into my decision for purchasing this camera. I was looking for something cute that could easily fit into my pocket and accompany me on all my water activities in the summer. I also needed it to take fairly good photos in all kinds of light and be user friendly. This camera satisfied all of the above.Water: I go on many float trips in the summertime and like to take photos of all our activities. I took this camera on a three day camping/floating trip almost immediately after purchasing. I was able to get it wet, use it in the water, and snap pics with wet hands- all without worrying. The manual does recommend letting it soak in clean, warm water after use- take this advice! I used it in the river and didn't clean it afterward- resulted in some of my photos I took at night being foggy from the dirty water that remained. The next time, I cleaned it and had no issues.Photo quality/ease of use: My pictures in and out of the water look great! I'm still exploring all the (many) features and specific settings, but so far I love it! There are a lot of settings and options, so if anyone knows a good tutorial on these, please share. I love the many options to scroll through the photos stored on the camera card. The only small issue is something that someone else had mentioned: it is very easy to put your fingers in the way of the camera on the left side. But as long as you are aware of it, I don't think it's a dealbreaker.Touch screen: This was my biggest concern about any camera. I had a Fujifilm touchscreen camera before and absolutely hated it. So naturally, I was apprehensive about purchasing another camera with this feature. I'm glad that I went ahead and gave it a try- the use of this touch screen is much better than my previous experience! The icons are close together- again, there are many options- but they stylus provided is helpful for people with bigger fingers.This camera is much more stylish than other waterproof options out there- it is only slightly larger than my iPhone 4 and easily fits in my pocket. It comes with a wrist strap so it is easy to hold onto- and the stylus snaps right on to the strap cord. One HUGE bonus that no one has really touched on is the charger. It charges the battery inside the camera and the cord hooks up to the charger via USB port, so I can charge it in my car when needed. This was very convenient because the battery life isn't all that strong. I did make it last for two nights of camping and an all day float trip, but I was careful to turn it off when not in use.This was a great purchase- I'm very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Sony water proof camera that is not really waterproof! very disappointing
Reviews.Author: L. Cassis "NYHacker"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the DSC-TX20 for my wife due to the waterproof feature and shock proof feature. not to mention the Sony brand it looks very cool. Picture quality is pretty good, pixel peeking shows some noise, but for its size and megapixel, its good. Video is the same, dont expect the best here for the price range and size, but enough to make you happy. The touch screen is a bit quirky, and somewhat annoying, but you get used to it after a while, you just press a little harder. battery life is soso, maybe 200 shots and you are done, mostly because of the nice large touchscreen. Build quality feels good, apparently the colored models are made of different material than the black. we purchased the orange and it felt a little cheap compared to the black one.My problem is the first time we took it in the water, and yes, I read the manual and instructions etc, after about 10 mins, it took on water and was damaged. Took it back to the Sony store and they said I voided the warranty, for getting my waterproof camera, well, wet! in detail, they claimed I damaged the battery door as it was not aligned correctly, I told them this is how it came. the tech didn't believe me and I told him to get a new one out of the box and have look. it was the same. unfortunately, this was not enough and Sony will not honor my warranty. im now forced to join the ranks of people who will not purchase Sony products again.

Reviews.Title: Not WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: ReviewByMe
Reviews.Content: I purchased the previous version of this camera, the DSC-TX5, in 2010. It had worked perfectly since then, the only reason I replaced it was for superficial reasons - the color had come off the lens.In MAY, I purchased the DSC-TX20 thinking if I was happy with the first one, I'd be thrilled with the updated version.How wrong was I!My original camera I had taken on every vacation and done everything with it from snorkeling in Hawaii to tubing in Texas and skiing in Colorado. Loved it! I haven't taken a bad photo since getting it.I purchased the TX20 right before leaving for a vacation in the Caribbean and left my old camera behind. I am so disappointed I did! The second day I used this camera, it died. First day - no problems. Lots of photos that all looked great. I went snorkeling on Day 2 and not 5 minutes after getting in the water, it died.This thing is NOT waterproof. I took FOUR photos in the water before it died. My hand was 3 feet from the surface so depth wasn't the issue.I didnt bother contacting Amazon for a replacement because it was past the 60 day mark when I finally returned home so I called SONY.DO  NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THEM! Their reps were awful. I got the run around and was told it wasn't working because of blunt force trauma...despite the fact that there isn't a single dent, not even a tiny superficial scratch on it. Either this camera was assembled wrong or there is something up with the water seals.I'm super disappointed. Even though I loved my first camera, I will not buy a SONY product again. It's not worth the risk of it being another faulty product and having to deal with their terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: Not a good underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Gundersen
Reviews.Content: Camera is great on land, but sucks for underwater. Leaked on first trip snorkeling and corroded all connections. Would never even consider buying this camera again if for underwater usage.

Reviews.Title: JUNK!  SONY will NOT stand behind warranty!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: John Farren
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in December 2012, unfortunately not from Amazon but directly from Sony.  I used the camera 3 times!!!!!  It is supposed to be at least "water resistant"??????  NOT!  I did not even try to take underwater pictures, it was in my pocket for about 20 seconds & got dunked in the water when I was putting my boat in.  It was dead after that so I had no camera for the rest of my trip.  I sent in the camera for repair under warranty to SONY....their "technician" found that the "waterproofing" was in tact but they found "corrosion" damage so they voided the warranty & would not honor it.  Nice job guys.....you have successfully lost my business for ANY electronics for the rest of my life!!!!!!!!On top of that, SONY wanted to charge me $600 to fix a "camera" that I bought new for less than $200?????  REALLY SONY????  hahaDO NOT EVEN ATTEMPT TO USE THIS CAMERA NEAR WATER!  It was a great camera the two times I used it.  SOOOOOOOO  tired of big corporations doing this type of thing.NEVER AGAIN SONY

Reviews.Title: Cool looking camera that is water resistant
Reviews.Author: Leena1126
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Sony camera and I have always bought a waterproof housing kit to go along with my cameras. When I saw that the T series was waterproof I decided to make a trip to the Sony store and check it out.what I needed:Zoom while video-recordingmacro shots - like taking a photograph of your fingerprint if you wanted tooSomething sleek and compact - this comes in many colors but I got the black one.That's pretty much it. I'm not a pro-user. I have a toddler so in addition to carrying all his toys and diaper things I didn't want to lug around a big DSLR.Pros:Small, sleek designWaterproof - when you have a kid, you want to get in on the action with them. I went to a water park and wasn't worried about getting my camera wet.Optical zoom while recordingWith a very fast mover toddler I make use of the multiple frame bursts. You can take up to 10 photos in one instant and when you review it, you tilt the camera and it goes from frame to frame. Pretty cool to see your toddler dancing and you're controlling the speed and the direction he's going in the images.You can adjust which "buttons" are shown on the LCD screen. Because I use the frame burst feature quite a bit, I added it onto my home screen so I can access it easier.There are some features where you can make the background fuzzy and focus in on only a certain part of the photo. The image looks like it was taken with a DSLR camera.Cons:Takes some time "processing" the image after I finished taking a pic. I think I was using the "intelligent" mode though.It also takes some time when you can actually scroll through the pics. You have to wait til the page loads and it takes some time. It's kinda irritating.You can only force flash when you're in certain modes.The pictures you take during the video are not so good quality.The touchscreen doesn't compare to the iPhone.I wish Sony would install some time lapse software and color selection (e.g. take a photo in black and white but select out one or two colors so a red rose and everything else i black and white).Other than the slowness of the camera I think it's great if you're looking for a rugged camera and if you have a toddler =)I will definitely buy another waterproof Sony camera after this one.

Reviews.Title: I'd give it 0 stars if possible
Reviews.Author: neveragain
Reviews.Content: Had a Sony TX10 and the latch broke so Sony sent me the TX20 since they couldn't get the part. I took it to Mexico about a week after it arrived and on day 3 I took it snorkeling for about 15 minutes. I went to charge it later that day and there was water in both access doors and it no longer works. Terrible "waterproof" camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Andrew Carver
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my TX5 drowned in the pool (my fault, I forgot to clean the seals after using it in salt water).  I have to say the TX20 is a major upgrade from the TX5, the photo quality is better and the video quality is incredible.  I was always a bit dissapointed with the TX5 due to it's fair picture quality and clunky touch screen but loved every other aspect of the camera.  The TX20 fixes these problems and more.  The touch screen is now capacitive instead of resistive which enables it to be as accurate as a quality smart phone screen and the photo quality is much better.  The photos from the TX20 look more vivid and life-like when compared to the TX5 and the video is much smoother.  It is very fast and responsive in every aspect and is fun to use.  Many fun picture effects to play with too.  As with the TX5 the best part in my opinion is the durability, I like knowing that my camera can come anyplace I want to go.  What good is a camera really if you can't use it anyplace you want?  Another major upgrade in my opinion is this camera's ability to take photos while recording video, I have already found this feature to be extremely useful.  The only negative I can think of is maybe the battery life, however this can be fixed by purchasing the Wasabi brand replacement batteries which last about 1.5X longer in my experience.  Bottom line if you're looking for a compact camera that takes very good photos and stunning quality video and durability is a factor then this is your camera.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: EXTREMELY SUSCEPTIBLE TO SPONTANEOUS CRACKS IN CASING
Reviews.Author: t
Reviews.Content: The camera looks and functions great out of the box, but its appeal quickly disappears once you realize how susceptible the casing is to sprouting spontaneous cracks. Within the first weeks of having the camera, I dropped the camera off of a low table (admittedly my fault), and the camera case cracked in several places. I was flabbergasted that a camera advertised as being shockproof would perform so poorly. (After all, I've had cameras that weren't advertised as being shockproof weather much worse mishaps without incident.)I was able to have the camera repaired under warranty, only to discover after my return from several months abroad, that they returned the camera to me with some of the same cracks still clearly there! So not only was I deprived of the use of my camera during a trip I specifically purchased it for, I returned only to find that it hadn't even been properly repaired! I sent the camera back in again, and this time it came back to me with a properly repaired case.Flash forward a few months, when I discover (before another trip), that the battery compartment has a crack in it! This time the crack is not the result of any precipitating event, and it likely occurred when I merely pressed down on the door to close the compartment. I once again send the camera in for repairs (again deprived of its use during a trip), and it is repaired and sent back to me.I recently sent in the camera for the FOURTH time, for a cracked case, once again on the battery compartment door. This time they claim that the fissure was caused by my dropping the camera, even though the camera is in pristine condition because it has spent more time out of service than in my possession! (Seriously, in addition to the camera constantly being in for repairs, I rarely use the camera, which is why I only notice the problems before trips. I also have a dSLR that I use as my primary camera, so this point and shoot gets very little use--which is what makes this situation even more ridiculous!) If there is a dent on one corner, as they claim (it is still in the possession of their repair department), it is the result of the first incident, which by its very position in the timeline of events, cannot be the cause of this crack. I tried to dispute their finding because I definitely have not dropped the camera since its last repair (or since the first incident), to no avail--they want to charge me more to repair the camera than I paid for the camera new on Amazon!So a word to all those considering this model: it looks pretty now, but you won't think so once the case continuously sprouts new cracks due to no fault on your part, not to mention when Sony tries to charge you an exorbitant fee to repair a defective product. Do a quick google search for "cracked TX20 case" and you will see that this is not an isolated incident. I have probably purchased 15 Sony cameras in the past dozen years or so, and this one is likely my last.Oh--and the primary reason I purchased this camera was so that I could use it underwater, but I have never been able to test this feature because it is always out of commission! And it looks like I never will be able to, as I won't be paying more to fix it than it cost.

Reviews.Title: Product seal doesn't work. Terrible customer service.
Reviews.Author: J. Tsai
Reviews.Content: I bought the Sony DSC-TX20 in December of 2012. Used it in Hawaii in January and used it again in the pool in June of 2013. I only used it twice, and always made sure the camera seals were completely clean before immersion. I've used Canon products underwater before and am familiar with proper care and use of underwater cameras.When I used it in the pool the second time, the seal somehow failed and allowed a little water into the camera. Even though I was not near the maximum depth for the camera, some water got into the camera and it stopped working. Again, prior to immersion, I had checked the seals and ensured that the openings had positively latched.After I sent it into Sony, their customer service center informed that it was not covered by warranty due to corrosion in the camera. Their explanation was that it was "uneconomical to fix the camera, so the warranty was void." To me, this is completely illogical and unfair. Not only could they not tell me how the cameras were tested to see if there was a seal or product failure, two of the four people I was transferred to were somewhat rude. The third, who supposedly worked for the national customer service center, ended up telling me that she was going to transfer me to the tech center that had the unit in hand and were the ones that tested it. She ended up transferring me to the first unit. The final individual was rude and told me he couldn't transfer me to anyone, or back to the original unit. I was told, again, that because there was corrosion in the camera, they would not honor the warranty. They could not seem to understand that the water and corrosion in the camera was because of a product defect.So, I'm out the price of the camera after two uses, including warranty shipping back to the Sony customer service center. I've been a long fan and customer of Sony products, but this has definitely turned me off. I would highly recommend against this camera, and, after the customer service experience, against Sony cameras at the very least.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic all around family camera
Reviews.Author: Dave Brinda
Reviews.Content: This is our second Cybershot TX underwater camera, and we love it. This new model has considerable improvements over the original. The capacitive touch screen is SO much better than resistive on our older model. This is by far the best family camera we've owned. The waterproof, shockproof design means this goes everywhere the family goes...the beach, pool, jet skiing, wake boarding, kayaking, rafting, zip line in Maui, snowboarding, it's been on all our trip and taken a beating. The best part is that it looks and feels like a normal point and shoot so it blends in during non-extreme events, where a hard-core ruggedized underwater camera would just look ridiculous.If you are looking for a great all around camera that goes where other cameras (and iPhones) fear to go, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: Solid construction, awesome pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Spivey
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet. This camera is a great point and shoot for everyday use. The ability to take your camera everywhere and in any weather. I have taken this through cenotes, beaches, and many other harsh conditions for a normal camera and it came through with flying colors. I spent a week on the grand canyon rafting in wooden boats and this thing took a beating including being dropped from 4 feet onto solid rocks and kept taking stunning photos. Sony nailed it with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Gift from Amazon
Reviews.Author: POE
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my son and his wife to take on their honeymoon in Hawaii. The pictures and video they shared with me when they returned were phenomenal. He recorded underwater with great clarity and took hundreds of pictures that captured their honeymoon beautifully. My son reported the camera was easy to use and "a great gift".

Reviews.Title: Too good to be true
Reviews.Author: lovemyhound
Reviews.Content: Camera was pretty amazing until it broke on our 3rd day of vacation. The seals are a joke. We had serious doubts that they would hold up unfortunately we were right.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Just Beachin'
Reviews.Content: I live on the gulf and really wanted a camera that I could throw in my beach bag and take on the boat without worry.  The fact that this camera also takes great underwater pictures is a huge bonus.  I have only had this camera a few weeks but LOVE it so far.  It has quite a few fun photo editing options and I am still discovering new things about it.  I used it on a long weekend getaway to Cape San Blas and got some great pictures while snorkeling.  It is easy to use and seems durable.  The camera spent hours hanging under the water from a floating strap on my wrist and no problems.  The colors look really nice too. I have read other reviews about the camera getting water damage.  Mine is doing great so far, but I did buy a squaretrade warranty for peace of mind.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony wouldn't honor warranty... at first!
Reviews.Author: Z. Matthews
Reviews.Content: I am ashamed to say I fell for the bait! I bought this camera on a black friday deal in 2012. I let it sit until early spring and thought I would give it a shot in our pool. I ENSURED I followed the instructions to make sure the seal was water tight. Low and behold, 101 pictures later I have a brick. I let it sit for a month or so before calling in to claim the warranty.Here is the interesting part. They approved the RMA but when it arrived at the factory they DENIED the warranty request stating there was water in the battery compartment and corrosion was present. My response, "yeah, so? the seal FAILED" Sony responded back to me stating they did their vacuum test and it worked.Let me back up, in addition to following their procedures to ensure it was certified waterproof, I held my finger over the battery flap to ensure it did not move. Yet, it was USER error that caused the corrosion.So after multiple calls they refuse to fix it and tell me they are sending my brick back... waaaait a minute. Sony, I have TONS of your products through out my home. I'm typing this from a Sony Vaio laptop... You mean you aren't standing behind your warranty and name and blaming the little guy who just wants to snap cute pics of his daughter underwater?My wife and I wouldn't have it. I did a quick search for important people's emails and sent out the hail mary e-mail bomb, including a great shot of my daughter underwater. My wife took to the facebook and twitter battlefield.  To our surprise, someone listened and decided to stand behind their warranty. They stopped shipment of the brick and sent a new camera. THANK GOODNESS!Now, why rate it one star? For starters it is now just a point and shoot camera as we are too afraid to take it in the water if the last one failed and we did everything right (and the fact that it tested functionally waterproof at the factory). And the fact I had to fight for a company the size of Sony to stand behind its name and warranty.I'm not saying this isnt a great camera or not waterproof. I'm saying buyer beware (and read above if you want to fight the warranty!)

Reviews.Title: Sony Waterproof camera is not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Paul Steele
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year to be used this June on vacation in Key West used the camera once and it broke. Sent it out to have repaired it has water damage and sony does not cover that. So dont buy this camera or any other Sony "waterproof" ones because is not waterproof and Sony will not cover repairs

Reviews.Title: best pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: Cjwhittington
Reviews.Content: IMO this camera can't be beat. The macro is amazing. This camera is so small you take out anywhere and nobody will notice. It does take a little time to process low light pictures but they come out good.If you have really large hands, the touch screen could be difficult to use because the icons are very small.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for any mom
Reviews.Author: Soobeen Chae
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my wife who wants to take pics of my kid playing at the pool everyday. She loves its easy menu system and excellent image quality. Of course it is a way better than her iPhone 4 camera and Sony HX5 she used to have for last two years. She is using it with Eye-fi SD card and they works like an amazing duo and images transfer to iPhone 4 extremely easy.Using it underwater also works quite well and my whole family is enjoying every single day. FIVE STAR and Highly Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: For a compact camera this is it, nice and small and i can use the touch screen with my big fingers with no problem. Takes great pictures and i figured out all its functions very quick. Night or no light pictures are awesome, the macro function is great i can take pictures of my finger prints crystal clear. I have not nor will i use under water, i bought a camera to carry in my pack when i am hunting, fishing etc. that would hold up to a little rough handling and could take a little water splash, snow, humidity. I would recommend you put a screen protector on it as soon as you take it out of box.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater photos but viewfinder hard to see
Reviews.Author: Brent C.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera prior to a recent trip to the Bahamas as I wanted something to take with me while snorkeling.  The underwater photo color and clarity were much better than I expected, but I had a hard time seeing anything through the viewfinder while snorkeling on a bright sunny day. I resorted to just pointing in the general direction of the object I wanted to capture and hoping I captured it in the frame. As such, I've had to manually crop a lot of my photos to recenter my target.I used this camera for a lot of everyday photos while on the trip, and while the quality isn't on par with my Nikon DSLR (my primary camera), it was actually quite good for a point and shoot. The menu is easy to navigate, the battery was better than expected, the shutter is responsive enough, and the size is very convenient for throwing it into my pocket. Overall, not a bad little camera even despite the viewfinder visibility in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY if you are using in water!
Reviews.Author: Jessica "seattlechic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a vacation and was able to use it ONE day.  After that it no longer turned on.  I sent it in for repair and they said there was corrosion and would NOT fix or replace it.  Somehow it is my fault that their seal is bad??  I followed the instructions exactly, running it under fresh water and soaking it in the sink for 10 minutes to be sure any salt water was out.  Obviously not all of these cameras are made well.  My friend got the SAME camera and had the same problem on her cruise, I'm not sure if these are a bad batch or what.  I am just in shock that they did nothing about it and don't care.

Reviews.Title: What Sony TX10 should have being in the first place
Reviews.Author: J. Liu
Reviews.Content: I had the Sony TX10 and returned it.  My biggest problem with TX10 is the software respond time.  Everything is slow on the TX10,  from accessing the menu to call up options.  Especially when switching from photo to video recording mode.  It takes a good 5-8 seconds when you press the "red" record button to actually start recording.  It is simply unacceptable,  I can't understand SONY release a product other than planning selling an upgrade version (tx20) 10 months down the road.Now, the new TX20, everything is very snappy, it takes about 2 seconds to switch from photo mode to actually start recording quite a dramatic improvement.  The camera power up quickly and can take photo right away.  The menu responds time also improve drastically, almost as good as iphone 3GS smooth.The capacity touch screen is much more responsive as well.  You can finally feel happy using this product and not having the urge to smash it to the ground to pieces.Overall all, I think it's a shame that Sony created a great looking TX10 and gave it a software like it's in 1970's slow menu.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: As a regular camera, it was great....look for another one though if you're looking for a waterproof camera. The first time we took it in the water, it stopped working. When we got back from vacation, we contacted Sony and sent it off for repairs. The repair shop in Laredo called us to inform us that it is not covered under warranty because of water damage. Even though Sony's website says that it's guaranteed waterproof, it's not covered by the warranty. They offered to send us a newer model, bit it would cost us $200. Why in the world would I buy another one??? We've talked to several departments in Sony and they all say the same thing, they're not budging. We're stuck with a $200 piece of junk!! I'm do disappointed in Sony.

Reviews.Title: FAIL! Sony, again.
Reviews.Author: E. B. Shepherd
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Sony camera in the past - and ALL of them have failed or broken in surprising ways unrelated to any actions of the owner. I wrote off ALL Sony products due to their unreliability. After much searching and reading positive reviews on this site I decided to chance Sony again and bought this camera. I had it for 1 month. The picture and video quality are great, although midtone contrast control isn't as good as my old Casio. But I was happy with this camera. I used it once in a pool a few days after receiving it, and after reading all the details in the owner's manual about how to get it wet and what to do afterwards. The camera survived it's first pool outing fine. Yesterday I took it in a pool for the second time. Again, following all the directions and being careful with it. Afterwards it still functioned (several hours later) after it dried from its rinse-off. Then at the doctor's today and found that it wouldn't turn on AT ALL. When I got it home I opened the compartments (never opened anywhere near water!) and discovered the UBS connector have a lot of corrosion on it, oozing up from inside the camera. Obviously the camera is dead now, so I called Amazon and they promptly sent me an email for the return label. Sony SCREWED ME AGAIN with a fragile camera that didn't live up to their advertisements...the day before I leave on a snorkeling trip!NO MORE SONY PRODUCTS - EVER AGAIN! (again)

Reviews.Title: Stopped working 3 days after buying
Reviews.Author: Alberto Santelices
Reviews.Content: Ok, so there were reviews that were not very encouraging but, the odds were in favor of the camera based on 4-5 stars vs the one and two's. So I took a chance andI lost. The camera was fine the day it arrived, I fully charged the battery and tried a few shots, everything in working order and ready for our vacation. On the day we arrived at the port to take our cruise, turned the camera on to grab so quick shots of the ship and what a disaster, could not see the LCD screen at all, everything was going crazy on the display, lines running up and down, and not showing any of what was in front of the camera. Tried all kinds of things trying to make it work but no such luck. I have the return label and on Monday, back it goes. Maybe just bad luck in my case, but if you are trying to purchase this camera to take on a vacation or other special occasion, I would strongly suggest to put the camera through more than just a few test shots, take as many pics as you can for a few days before your intended use.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!!
Reviews.Author: B.O.E "Lovely Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera on an Amazon one day sale for half the price and if I knew how great it was i would have paid full price a long time ago!!! This camera is so easy to use and the pictures are crisp and clear even in low light!!! Its small and convenient to carry and I would HIGHLY recommend this product for anyone looking for a GREAT camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX20
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R. Li
Reviews.Content: I own few Canon pocket cameras. However, This one is much better than them. Of course, this is more pricy than the Canons.This camera's touch screen functions are very easy to use. I can easily change my settings with few touches on the screen. However, the touch screen is not very sensitive enough sometime. especially the right scrolling bar (which is similar to the browser's up and down scrolling side bar). Most of times, I needed to repeat the same action multiple times to make the screen to scroll up or down once.Things that I like this camera are: 0) photo quality is great!  1) 1080i video. 2) can take photos during filming. (I love this feature). 3) zooming does not blur the video quality. 4) water resistance. 5) lens cover. 6) lens completely seal inside the body.Lastly, this camera does work under the water. I used it for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Oleg
Reviews.Content: I use this camera as a simple, durable, compact point-and-shoot for walking around, and esp. for cycling.It is very portable - fits easily in the pocket, and can be easily operated with one hand, which is important on the bike. No moving zoom-out parts, simple operation.It's sweat/water proof and shatter-proof.Photos are very good quality, considering the size of the camera. Of course it cannot replace or compete with my DSLR camera, but for small size you can't expect much.Panoramic shots are a nice tough. I have to say that HDR photos are a bit much, even on the "weakest" setting. The background blur photos feature is nice, and comes out well for some shots, but for others (complicated backgrounds) it looks too "fake" looking, compared to shallow depth of focus you get from large aperture cameras. Overall, many of the picture settings are a bit gimmicky - I may end up shooting mostly in intelligent auto setting.PS: I provided some samples of the photos taken with the camera here:[...]

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Nathalie
Reviews.Content: Someone stole my camera, i had this one, but the 2011 model... so, i wanted to buy the same one, cause i was quite happy about my camera. I decided finally to go with the 2012 model.I just love it : the touch screen is much better now !the colour is perfect, the entire collection is beautiful.if you are questionning yourself about a camera : don't waste your time anymore : take this one :)

Reviews.Title: Sony Doesn't Back Their Products
Reviews.Author: Mountainjack76
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 11 months ago, and had been very happy with the camera. The versatility of going from video, to camera to underwater was amazing, and all for $235. All went well for the last 11 months until a recent trip to Mexico. It worked for 1 day on the trip and then died. I thought it might have been the battery. When that wasn't the problem, I contacted Sony Repair. They had me send it in and told me it should be covered under the warranty since it was less than 12 months old.Well, long story short, Sony told me the repair would cost me $435 and claims that there was physical damage, which voided the warranty. There certainly wasn't any physical damage when I shipped it. I think that they just don't want to honor the warranty because it is almost over. I will NEVER buy another Sony product because they do not want to stand behind what they manufacture. As to the repair cost, why would anyone do that, when you can buy another camera for $200 less than the repair costs. They should have just repaired it or replaced it because it was still under warranty. Shame on you Sony!

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof!!!
Reviews.Author: CorsoGirl
Reviews.Content: Sony started making HORRIBLE waterproof cameras!  its the 3rd model I get that brakes due to water damage!!!  These are not cheap and yes, they look nice and I love the features, but I really wanted waterproof.  Never again I will buy sony..

Reviews.Title: Ok camera with TERRIBLE customer service!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: My review is somewhat mixed. The camera takes great pictures, but the touch screen seems to be somewhat delayed and not the most user friendly. I can overlook that. My primary concern is customer service. This camera is marketed as shockproof/shatterproof from 5 ft. This is one feature that attracted us since we have a young child. As expected, the camera was dropped from about 2 feet and a crack appeared on the back glass. We sent the camera in before the one year warranty expired and were informed that it would cost more to repair than it would to replace the camera. Instead of offering us a replacement camera free of charge, we were offered a replacement for MORE than what we paid for the camera originally! I asked numerous times to talk to someone else and was told that it was the "final resolution" and no one else would help me. I highly recommend looking elsewhere for a camera... perhaps with a company that actually provides good service! No more Sony products for this family!

Reviews.Title: The Review I wish I had read...
Reviews.Author: Eddy Gil
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews on item I purchased but I cant help it but write one about this camera.I purchased this Camera last December. I love Sony products, they have a tendency to deliver quality and good performance in all their products, so when I began my search for a good pocket-sized camera, Sony was my first pick. I wanted a waterproof camera to take with me on my Honeymoon (May, 2013) and this camera had all I was looking for.I must be honest and tell you I loved everything about this camera. The look was amazing, features too! Picture quality was beyond I expected! If I had written this review 3 months after my purchased, would have been a solid 5 stars. Then why 1 Star?Before purchase any item, I always read the reviews to know how the products performs in real life. But been a Sony product I didnt care much to read the reviews (terrible mistake) since I looked great at a first glance. I used my camera on 5 different occasions, 3 of them being underwater scenario. Last July I took my camera to the Beach and It began to act weird on the Touchscreen (I would not response as quick as before when I touched it) then few hours later it stopped working. Then, few minutes later, my screen goes black and shuts down my camera, never to be turned back on again. I sent my camera back to Sony since I was within my warranty period. Upon arrival, the check my camera and told me I had "Corrosion Damage". Which means my WATER LEAKED IN! Sony claims I mishandle my device and thus my warranty was VOID!If one thing I did right, it was the way I handle my device. I read thru the entire manual upon arrival, I followed their procedures every single time I used it (Making sure all my ports where closed correctly, never taking it below water resistant level, always washed it with fresh water after every use, etc), including the fact I only took it underwater 3 times!!!Sony was kind enough to give a me a "special" offer to purchased the same camera (Newer Model) for $299.00. I would rather donate that money to a Dog Shelter rather than buying another Sony Not-waterproof "waterproof" Camera.I went back on Amazon and looked at the reviews more carefully only to discover I wasn't the only one with this issue. Many other buyers had the same problem of "Corrosion Damage" and were treated the same way. I wish I would had pay more attention to these reviews.Bottom line is, Don't purchase this camera if you are planning on taking it underwater. It work great in land (like every other camera) but chances are, if you take it underwater, you will get stuck with a $300 door stop like me.

Reviews.Title: Poor build quality
Reviews.Author: B. Buran
Reviews.Content: While the pictures are generally of good quality and we've had great fun with the various modes (especially the panorama setting), the build quality is extremely poor for a camera that is billed as shock-proof.  Within a few months, the plastic around the battery door had broken off (we never dropped the camera).  Sony replaced the plastic housing free of charge the first time; however, a month later the plastic broke off again!  This time Sony wanted to charge a $25 repair fee even though it was still in-warranty.

Reviews.Title: do NOT buy - NOT waterproof - TERRIBLE customer service
Reviews.Author: Alana E. Zorrilla
Reviews.Content: I took this brand new "waterproof" camera into less than an inch of water (after carefully following the instructions re using the camera under water), it took a couple pictures and then never worked again. Sony said over the phone that it would be covered under their warranty and asked me to send it in for repair (with receipt and other info).  A couple weeks later Sony called me saying they cannot fix the camera, but have a special "offer."  They proceeded to "offer" to sell me the same camera for $200 ($50 more than I paid for it in the first place).  They took me through their "escalation" procedures (getting to the purported top of the chain in the Phillipines, keeping me on the phone an hour), the end result being a royal waste of time and money.  They are not going to stand behind their product, fix it or replace it.  Terrible experience.  Do not buy this camera or anything made by Sony.  They are unreliable and the customer service is atrocious.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after first time use in shallow ocean waters.
Reviews.Author: Audrey G.
Reviews.Content: Will be returning this item as it stopped working after using once in ocean water.  Very disappointing as was not able to use for the snorkeling adventure that was planned the day after. I had checked and rechecked to insure that the slots were properly secured.  I soaked it in warm water for 10 minutes or more then wiped it dry. Then I re-charged the battery thinking that perhaps it stopped as the battery ran out(although I doubted it as I used only for a short period of time). Still did not work even if I followed the instructions, so I had to quickly purchase another underwater camera for the outing(a Canon Powershot D20-which worked really well).

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: Addie
Reviews.Content: This product lasted me ONE DAY ONLY! After taking the precautionary procedures in cleaning it after being in the ocean, it would not turn on! After sending it back for repair, they tried to blame it on me saying that it passed their water test and it must've been that I had used it improperly.  Very unprofessional customer service!!! And all a scam. This camera is a waste of your time and money! I hope nobody else gets caught in this trap like I did.

Reviews.Title: Below my expectations
Reviews.Author: Ayman Raslan
Reviews.Content: Video quality is not that great very normal, my 3 year old camera produced better videos. Overall pictures quality was way below my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Similar Problem as Others - But Sony Stepped Up!!
Reviews.Author: Hornet
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item for our June 2013 Carribean cruise and snorkeling adventure....took fantastic pics out of the water, but failed not 5 minutes into snorkeling!! This was the first time it was exposed to water - and all instructions were followed for underwater usage.  I hadn't taken more than 20 total pics on dryland, and managed to get 2 underwater shots (which were very clear and high quality btw) before the camera screen went blank, powered off, and would not turn on again.  The camera would not charge, and after getting it back on the boat for closer inspection, noticed the battery compartment was wet.  The seals all looked perfect, so no idea how this thing took on water - but to say we were dissappoitned was an understatment.We were extremely dissappointed as the snorkeling trip was the reason for the purchase, and we didnt take an extra camera on the trip, but immediately contacted Sony upon our return.  They were very helpful, issued an event id/work order #, and was instructed to return the product to them.  A few days after it arrived, Sony called and apologized for the failure, told me they could not repair it as it had corrosion inside, and stated they'd be sending me a newer model as a replacement at no charge.  WOW!! After reading some of the reviews on here I was worried I was going to be SOL, however Sony stepped up and handled this in a prompt and professional manner! Hopefully this newer model has been improved and is actually 'waterproof'....going to have to figure out a way to book another cruise and snorkeling trip to test it out!Sony - thanks again for the service and support!!!  I give this 3 stars as the camera was awesome outside of water, seemed to take awesome pics underwater, but failed not 5 minutes into snorkeling.  Sony stepped up and stood behind their product - which speaks volumes of the great company they are!!  I can't wait to get the newer replacement and try it out!

Reviews.Title: Great quality
Reviews.Author: christine
Reviews.Content: I am a review fanatic so I spent awhile going over many many waterproof cameras before I decided on this one. I have not tried it under water yet, but just using it around the house it's great. The quality is really good for such a little camera. I do professional photography, and wanted a small camera just to carry around for photos for when I don't want to lug around my big dslr. This camera is perfect, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Snorkeling Pictures!!
Reviews.Author: Maggiemom
Reviews.Content: We needed an underwater camera to take to Hawaii to capture memories while snorkeling. I read many reviews on this and other waterproof cameras only to be wary of buying any of them. I narrowed it down to the Nikon Coolpix AW100 and this camera. Some reviews were great but some were really scary. I researched for many weeks trying to make the right decision. We have used the old film camera as well as disposable cameras in the past, but never a digital camera. After much debate and trusting the mass of Amazon reviewers, we chose this camera in pink. I checked all the seals upon arrival and all was good. Bought my Chums float in case I dropped it in the ocean (A MUST have-hate to donate my brand new camera to the fish!). We took this camera on 6 snorkeling excursions and 6 additional days in the pool and this little camera was AWESOME! It has an underwater mode that really brings out the colors of the fish and the water. I took almost 1000 pictures and very few had to be deleted. I was amazed at the clarity and vibrant colors. We did follow the directions (rinsing after each use, inspecting the seals, etc) and have had no problems whatsoever. I am just so thrilled with the snorkeling pictures and the lifelong memories that we can put in the photo book. I had read somewhere on the web that some people were having trouble loading there pictures on to their Mac, but I had no trouble at all with a card reader.

Reviews.Title: Winner !!!  :-)
Reviews.Author: aka Sophia
Reviews.Content: I love this little gem! I also got it on the great lightening deal this past month at $149. I purchased the Panasonic FZ200 a month ago and took both on a recent trip to Disney World. The TX20 surpassed my expectations. I wanted to be able to capture photos when going on rides (especially the water rides like the rafting and log rides). I found myself using the TX20 90% of the time and eventually the FZ200 remained in the hotel room the last fews days as I hardly used it.The low-light capabilities are awesome. It is amazing how well this camera captures light to produce very good images. I tried to upload some images but something is wrong with Amazon's picture upload feature. The optical and digital zooms are also excellent for this type/size camera. It takes clear and crisp pictures. The macro feature is also great. I've had fun with the modes, picture effects and scene selections. The touch screen is very nice and easy to navigate. Takes great HD video quality even when shooting small details.  I'm very happy with my little sony. The fact it's tiny/pocketable, waterproof, dust/lint free and can take a few knocks is just icing on the cake. I wish I would have had the foresight to purchase 1-2 more to give as gifts at $149.There is a lot of information on the LCD screen on camera or playback mode but it's easy to remove all that by touching the "DISP ON/OFF" icon for about 2-3 seconds. It took a little while to figure that one out.One down side is it only takes about 250-280 pictures per battery charge. It's not enough of an inconvenience to remove a star. I just got extra batteries. Something that does annoy me a bit is that in playback/pic review, it takes about 4 seconds for the information to disappear. Once it does, it's gone and you can swipe or tab to the next picture.Overall, I highly recommend this treasure as it exceeded my expectations.Recommendations:Adjust the wrist strap so that it doesn't slide off your hand. I looped a knot in about an inch at one end to where it wouldn't slide off my wrist if it was accidently knocked out of my hand.Get a neoprene case that can hold at least 2 extra batteries. The battery only takes about 250-280 pictures. I'm a shutter bug and take about that many in a day when vacationing. I bought the rooCASE Neoprene Sleeve (Black) Carrying Case for Sony Cyber-shot Digital Camera DSC-TX20 TX66 TX200V WX50 WX70 WX150 W610 W620 W650 W690  which fits the camera and 2 batteries. I highly recommend it. Did the same wrist strap adjustment looping a knot on the strap on the case.Get 2 extra batteries and external charger. You will be glad you did. I purchased the Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Sony NP-BN1 and Cyber-shot DSC-T99, DSC-T110, DSC-TX5, DSC-TX7, DSC-TX9, DSC-TX10, DSC-TX20, DSC-TX55, DSC-TX66, DSC-TX100V, DSC-TX200V, DSC-W310, DSC-W320, DSC-W330, DSC-W350, DSC-W360, DSC-W380, DSC-W390, DSC-W.... It must be a rapid charger as the batteries charged in about 60 minutes. The batteries last as long as the original Sony brand that came with the camera and I paid less for the kit than I would have for 1 extra Sony battery.I got a 16GB SDHC card but I wish I would have bought the 32GB. The best pictures are those saved at the 16.2MP but the file size can quickly fill your card.

Reviews.Title: The best option for vacations!
Reviews.Author: Alexis Gomez
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this camera as it is very easy to use plus it provides great picture quality and the best is waterproof!Highly recommended for the whole family!!

Reviews.Title: Photography made intuitive
Reviews.Author: Tahir Popat
Reviews.Content: The Good:What I love most about this camera that I got on VenTribe.com and then invited my friends to contribute toward, is that the functionality is made simple. Instead of a bunch of settings that are hard to find/figure out. The settings on this do what they say and are easy to find:- Unsteady hand or moving kids- Use the anti-blur- Not bothered to optimize it manually - Use the auto mode (which is awesome by the way!)- Looking to make someone look pretty - Use the soft skin or natural felsh modes.The Bad:The buttons at the top are really close to each otherEven though its amazing - its still a little pricey - especially if your not going to use all the functions: unless you live by water- you don't really end up using the underwater function

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Jodi L. "Jodi L."
Reviews.Content: I recieved my Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX20 three days ago and I absolutely love it!  My last 3 cameras were all Canon powershots and I'm a big fan of Canon products so I was a little sceptical of switching to another brand.  After researching waterproof and durable cameras, this was rated as #2 and Im quite impressed with it.  Great color photos, easy to use with the touch screen, light & compact and overall looks sharp.  The only thing I'm not a fan of  is when you turn it on, the lense cover doesn't automatically come up, so you have to click the on button and lift the lid manually before you take a picture.  I'm sure they have a reason for this design (because it's waterproof??) but it is a little inconvient if you want to capture a quick spur of the moment photo.  Other than that, I'm really impressed with the camera and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Little Giant
Reviews.Author: Guilherme W. Dourado
Reviews.Content: Before buying this camera I heard a lot of bad things about it like: the touch-screen is unresponsive, you can't change the settings while underwater, there's a bit of a lag when you're using the quick menu such as erase, zoom in etc. But I decided to buy it anyways just for the waterproof characteristic.Well, those are true, BUT they are nothing compared to what this camera can provide in picture quality. The colors are amazing, the 1080p HD videos are superb and the menu options will not disappoint you. The intelligent auto-mode and the superior auto-mode will determine which kind of scene settings will be more appropriate and change it on it's own. But if you still want to choose the scene regardless of what the camera suggests, you can just go on the menu and have at it.One of the best features, in my opinion, is the panorama shooting scene. Just press and slide the camera from left to right and it is done. Also it is pretty cool that it shoots in 3D, so if you have a 3D TV it is definitely a major plus (I've never tried it myself though).But I urge you to keep in mind it's purpose. This is a quick-shot camera, so my review on it's quality and performance is based on that. We can't expect out pics to have the same quality as those high-techs professional ones. Even tough there are some features that lets you defocus the background, which can give your pics a little touch of professionalism and make it more artistic!Long story short:The PROS are way more numerous than the few, albeit slightly annoying at times, CONS.It is a beautiful camera, easy to handle and program and it is dust/shock/waterproof, which kind of also means that it is beerproof ... need I say more?Buy this camera and go Hakuna Matata you day!

Reviews.Title: Terrible image quality
Reviews.Author: Tino
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Sony DSC-TX20 because I was convinced by the nice reviews I was reading from many users. No matter what time of day or where I capture pictures, the images are terrible. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: it's unchargeable
Reviews.Author: jinsong wang
Reviews.Content: I buy it for my friend. After I use it two hours, I found the battery couldn't be charged. I tried and found the camera body had some trouble with charge. Although amazon can replace it, my friend will go abroad. He must take a indepedent charger for the camera. I felt worry for my friend unhappy.

Reviews.Title: Depressing...
Reviews.Author: Brian Horner
Reviews.Content: I have a pretty low bar to meet.  We had a Canon SD950is that worked great for years but needed to be replaced,  We are big campers so we opted for the TX20 to protect it against moisture or the occasional drop.  The reviews for this camera were so awesome that I jumped on it!The Good:- The form factor is nice and the camera is made of metal which feels nice to hold.  It slides easily into the smallest of pockets and despite its small size, my big hands were able to use the touch screen and press the right buttons.- The single button to start and stop movies was helpful and the ability to take pictures while filming a movie was very nice as well.- The movies were pretty darn good!The Bad:- The flash is waaaaay too bright.  It looks like there is a flashlight being shined on the center of our pictures and it looks very odd.- All of our indoor pictures came out blurry in automatic mode.  Yes, there are 50 other modes but you would expect to be able to open and shoot the camera in auto mode indoors during the day in well light spaces like schools.  Nope.  Blurry.- All my action shots were blurry.  I kept cleaning the camera with a lens wipe to ensure it was not dirty.- Spots. I don't know if this is reflective light from the crazy flash but there are orbs of light - like water spots, in many of our pictures.  This is a new camera and has never been used around water.  The camera is less than 5 days old!!!- The screen is already permanently "smudged" from being in my pocket.  The case has a tiny ding and we have never dropped it.  This means that just having it in my pocket has damaged the screen and body of the camera.  What good is being shock proof if the camera falls apart.- As with most Sony products, they thought it was a wise move to use a special cable instead of a standard micro USB cable like everyone else in the world.  Now you need to buy new cables.- The camera does not come with a external battery charger. You have to use the special cable and plug it into the special plug they provide.- My old Canon had a wheel with things like sports mode, portrait mode, macro mode...  On the TX20 you need to jump around on the touch screen to get to these modes.  it is very time consuming and inconvenient.We are returning our TX20 and going back to a Canon Powershot despite the fact that it will have inferior movie taking abilities.  I just need my camera to take pictures that look natural and that are not blurry.  Maybe ours was defective but because of several of our other "bad" list items - we have lost faith in this product.  I hope my review is helpful to you.

Reviews.Title: Second Cybershot - the BEST small camera
Reviews.Author: Pushka "Calliope"
Reviews.Content: This will be our second cybershot - our first one still works but we dont want to share it.  These cameras take the best photos - have never had a camera with such clarity, ease of use.  The HD video is simply amazing.  We took this on a trip to Europe and our photos are simply stunning! Being underwater and shock proof is also reassuring so you dont have to worry about rain or those knocks.  And it works very well underwater too.  Glad to have found such a reliable camera as I have certainly spent some money on others that simply do not work as well.

Reviews.Title: I had it crack in the same spot with 2 different cameras
Reviews.Author: Jodi Vermilyea
Reviews.Content: I loved my camera it took amazing great pictures both on land and in the water.  It also took very amazing videos.  The reason why I gave it one star is because on the back side of the camera at the bottom of the touch screen by where your battery and SD card go there is nothing but a thin piece of plastic on that part of the frame.  With my first camera this piece cracked when the camera was 14 months old so it was past the warranty date.  I was so impressed with how the camera worked that I bought another one and after 10 months the frame broke on this one.  I recently contacted SONY before the warranty was up and they told me to send it in for review for repair, which cost me $14.to ship UPS.  They called me and told me that it was structural damage and they would not cover it, but they would send me a new model for $200.50.  I told them that I felt that I wasn't in the wrong after the same thing happened to 2 different cameras and with me using the padded carrying case for it.  They told me that they will not cover it.  I don't want to use my camera underwater anymore because of the missing piece of the frame I feel it would ruin the camera.  Very disappointed with Sony's lack of customer service.  I thought they would stand behind their products better than that.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 2 Vacations
Reviews.Author: Joe V.
Reviews.Content: This lasted for ten days in Hawaii, and two days in Mexico before water got in and ruined it.  We took GREAT care of it, soaked it everytime after being in salt water as recommended, and it still leaked.  We took great care of this camera after reading the negative reviews about this leaking, however ours still leaked.We got married in Mexico this summer, and this camera stopped working day two of our 14 day trip.  It is one thing when a product doesn't work, but to have your brand new camera stop working at the beginning of your 14 day vacation, much less wedding and honeymoon vacation...well lets just say you have been warned about this camera, just read the other negative reviews...I took the risk and lost out big time.Amazon was amazing about refunding our camera!  I can't say enough good things about Amazon's customer service!

Reviews.Title: Sony Brick
Reviews.Author: Gene Lee "Bloody"
Reviews.Content: Through Amazon.com, I purchased the waterproof camera (Sony DSC-TX20​)​ in February 20, 2013 for $199 + tax as a birthday present for myself for a friend's destination wedding in Hawaii and used it once in April 2013, then it suddenly stopped working. I never dropped it; I only used it in 1 foot of water in a pool (it is supposed to work up to 16 feet of water). Since then, it won't turn on and the battery won't recharge.
