It's basically nonfunctional.I was very disappointed, as it was a special occasion, plus I had high expectations of the quality of Sony's products. After drying it and several more attempts at recharging the battery, I hoped it would work again, but the attempts were futile. I returned the item to Sony in November (one year warranty).I received a call from a Sony representative on 12/17/13 who stated the waterproof camera is damaged due to "water or moisture", i.e. the lens and circuit board is corroded and beyond repair, offered a replacement to the newer model for $200. Essentially, I would be paying $400 for a new unit, because of a product manufacturer defect.I used the unit properly and it has failed to work and expected Sony to repair or replace the device, but instead they want to get more money from me for a product that was defective.I called Sony customer support and waited for 30 minutes, eventually hanging up without an answer.

Reviews.Title: Lies!
Reviews.Author: Maxine Thomas
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera dec 2012. It took good pics. However right now I am on vacation in Barbados and I went to the beach and the camera stopped working after being in the water for two mins.  Now it won't even turn on and I will be forced to have a picture-less vacation. :-(

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware - no Sony warranty (but Amazon is great)
Reviews.Author: K. Landis
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware!  I LOVED this camera until it quit after 6 months of use.  I've taken the camera twice to the caribbean.  It quit during my second trip.  I sent the camera to Sony for warranty/Service.  Upon opening the camera Sony found corrosion inside.  The service center stated that they would not repair the camera, due to the cost being $700, nor would they replace the camera due to the corrosion which voided the warranty.  How did the corrosion get inside the camera?  It didn't matter that this could have been a manufactures defect.  Their lack of logic is infuriating!  It's a waterproof camera that's not warrantied if water enters the case and corrosion begins.There is light at the end of the tunnel.  Buy from Amazon!  Amazon allowed me to return this camera for a full refund!  That is customer service you can PRAISE!

Reviews.Title: Orbs
Reviews.Author: Teddiebri
Reviews.Content: There is a scratch under the guard for the lense it is between the actual lense and the guard. It is nothing that I could've done it's a manufacture defect. Seems to take outside pictures okay but the ones that you take indoors have orbs all over the place.

Reviews.Title: WARNING DESIGN FLAW SONY WILL NOT STAND BEHIND!
Reviews.Author: R.M.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in May, 2013. My old camera was the TX5, owned it since it was "the new thing". I love that camera, just got old and developed a tremor when you turn it on. So I purchased the TX20 to replace it. Sony has lifted and extended the screen assembly to cover almost the entire back of the camera. This is a design flaw and causes cracks in the screen. Sony will not warranty it...they say it's "physical damage". It was not. The camera was in PERFECT CONDITION when I sent it in to be repaired, with the exception of a crack extending from the edge of the screen. They declined the replacement and told me the camera would cost more to repair than it is worth. Well there went my 200 plus dollars!!!!!! I have always believed Sony products were a good investment....no more. BAD SCREEN DESIGN...BEWARE

Reviews.Title: Sony is just awful.
Reviews.Author: Keith Pochy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera looking for something I wouldn't have to worry about possibly getting wet. And it did, however the seals apparently cannot take any water and water apparently corroded the inside of the camera. This could have been a defect but Sony informed me the corrosion inside the camera was not covered under the warranty, despite the fact that the camera is advertised as 'water proof'. However, the fine folks at sony were willing to offer to sell me a new camera that was priced higher than what I originally purchased it for. All in all I would have been better off throwing money out a window for I would have at least had the entertainment value of watching the dollar bills fly. Thanks for nothing Sony.

Reviews.Title: Very sad camera
Reviews.Author: Vaz Man
Reviews.Content: I only give it one star because you can't give it 0 stars. Not only is it not waterproof, it's not even water resistant.  First vacation, first day in the pool, less then in one foot of water and it leaked.  Sony couldn't fix it after 3 attempts, the warranty expired and they stopped responding to my requests.  Sony is definitely not what they used to be.  In my opinion they're just out for that quick buck now days.  The Sony quality has gone down the drain.My recommendation is to buy a camera from a known camera manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: It was a great little camera, until....
Reviews.Author: Lynn A. Allen "thundernlightning"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my husband in December 2012. It took great pictures, he used it on his 17 foot sailboat for filming and picture taking. The photos were great!  Then... We took it to the beach in July of this year and it suddenly stopped working.My husband sent it to Sony for repair and lo and behold, they told us the same thing they've told others here.  It was our fault moisture got into the camera. My husband apparently "abused" it.  They offered to sell us a new camera for $200, yeah right.... We paid $149.99 for this one.  We told them no thanks. I guess we're out $150 and a waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: ashley
Reviews.Content: the picture is clearvery easy to carrybut the locks for the access ports for card and battery is too easy to accidentallyopenmine was water damaged in 2 weeks because the access door was too easy to unlock

Reviews.Title: Sleek camera, no luck underwater!
Reviews.Author: puddles
Reviews.Content: I loved the size and feel of the camera, and combined with the sliding lens cover could take it anywhere comfortably in my pocket. Unfortunately it leaked and died the first time I tried out an underwater photo. I would have been happy with the camera if I only used it above water and enjoyed more peace of mind than with a non-rugged camera around pools, beaches, and ponds. Actually I considered buying a replacement and doing just that, but I'm upset with sony after the camera died in the middle of vacation so I think I will go with a different brand.I liked the article here [...] because it was one of the few reviews I found that did long term underwater testing, and they reported the same (leaking) problem with this camera.Good luck!

Reviews.Title: great pictures, tough
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: bought this for a trip to hawaii - i was nervous about the whole underwater thing but it worked great!  it even still functions after being attached to my wrist as a wave took me down and tossed me about - interestingly, it took a couple shots during that as well - kind of scary looking!  i have not yet tried it underwater again since then, as I think there's still some sand in it and want to make sure it's all cleared out so it seals well.took beautiful pictures while snorkeling and on land.  at the end of one long day with lots of photos, the battery did start to run down and performance dropped off quite a bit in terms of responsiveness.  love the panorama, though it's apparent that I was a little shaky on some of them....there might be a way to correct for this that i haven't learned of yet.overall, it was a great deal and a great small vacation camera.

Reviews.Title: Consider an older model the TX7..better built , superb sound, durable
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: Consider a better built, higher quality camera ..The Sony TX7  Best sound, heavier built, durable buttons and designed to long term use. This camera is nice, but is cheaply made, plastic buttons, smaller and lighter but more easily dropped. Not that impressed when compared to the TX7

Reviews.Title: Great camera poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Iceis "Ice"
Reviews.Content: The camera is great.  It takes great pictures and works under water.  I had the best time taking pictures in the pool and water rides.  The only thing that I would complain about is the battery life.  I have to carry 2 extra batteries to last a whole day of taking pictures and videos.  Also switching modes is a little tricky.  I usually can get around camera relatively easy but not with this one.  I leave it on auto and it takes great shots. I have also played around with the continuous shooting.  Still have to play around it with more to get the full benefits.  I gave it four stars due to the battery life.

Reviews.Title: Worst Warranty from SOny - No Waterproof no suppoort form Sony either
Reviews.Author: Julio
Reviews.Content: OK,it hapens to call my attention that almost everyone has bought this camera in 2012. SO you warranty is coming out as it did with mine.I bought mine from Sony EPP program. They gave a discount to the company I work on. Well, it got water on it while being less one feet deep and SOny didn't help or took responsibility.They said its is Certified waterproof, their website says: Model Highlights: Certified waterproof, dustproof and shockproof. Their customer service says it is not.They didn't help me and I need to pay for the repairs, FLAT fee 130USD or more if they find more damage once they have it on their repair department. That is how good companies die.Good luck if you wish to buy one.Sony said that there are not known issues of water damages, go figure about other reviews with the same issue here. :-)The foto quality is not beyond something else in the market.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera-Great Price
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: I had the TX-10 as my first camera a few years ago, I bought it from Sears on sale and didn't know much about it. It was a fantastic camera, I loved everything about it and would not have traded it for any other camera. 2 years later, it was stolen. But for 2 years I did not so much as consider another camera, it stayed in top condition and never failed me. So when I was in the market recently for a new camera, I shopped around through all the new, fancy cameras, and was underwhelmed. I bought and returned a Nikon coolpix s800c and loved the camera aspect, but nothing else, then nearly bought a nice cannon point and shoot, but finally decided to come back to the TX sony series. I couldn't be happier with my decision! They have revamped it from the old model, the underwater feature is wonderful, even if you're not on vacation, having the option to shoot pictures in the rain is nice. It has all the options in the world if you're meticulous about your pictures, and works extremely well for the lazy photographer when its left on auto. The touch screen is great, no problems at all and much easier than buttons. I love that photos are never blurry! I can take pictures from the car or while I'm walking and they turn out great! I would recommend this camera to anyone-it's the best on the market for its type if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: its a good camera
Reviews.Author: Kumar Kalloo
Reviews.Content: well it did what i needed it to, that is take pics at the beach and some under water shots while snorkeling. however, thank goodness i bought two! one was a bit faulty.... camera specs says water resistant down to 16 feet... well i was only in about 4 feet of water when i got a little shock. water got in and damaged the battery. the second one however worked like a charm and i was pleased with the images!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Mario Nicolas
Reviews.Content: This camera is very lightweight but powerfull, great low light performance and shutter speed. Thanxs sony for using SD cards haha

Reviews.Title: great camera!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: juan
Reviews.Content: Its fast, its perfect its portable its a great buy the picture quality is great and once you power it you can snap a picture in secods

Reviews.Title: great pics
Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: haven't used it underwater yet, only gotten splashedworks great, takes great pictures, love it!i plan to tests its "waterproof"-ness more in the future

Reviews.Title: all smiles ( ;
Reviews.Author: rudegyalk
Reviews.Content: hi everyone, well I ordered my camera at the end of march..so I'd like to compliment on how quick I received the camera. It came before its expected delivery time and I was very happy about this.I saved the email about writing the review due to me wanting to give myself some time to use the camera.the camera is money well spent. all it takes is some time of you playing around with it and getting use it.I will admit that I was nervous to try it underwater, but I let go of my fears and i tried it in the swimming pool on mothers day.the pictures turned out great! PLEASE LISTEN TO THE CLEANING INTRUCTIONS TO AID IN MAINTAINING A GOOD QUALITY CAMERA. That's all iv been doing and its been working fine.hope u guys enjoy this camera when you buy it as I am. God bless you all.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased this camera for some upcoming adventures. Got to test it out yesterday at Discovery Cove in Orlando, Fl. and it worked great. Went into the water with no problems and starting shooting video and taking pictures. It was great to be able to switch between photo and video so easily. Don't expect the best pictures in the world, but they are great for a point-n-shoot camera. Can't wait to take this on our next adventure.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Ever owned
Reviews.Author: Yepthatsme
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing underwater camera.  So crystal clear.  The video is superb as well.  I connected it to our 65 inch flat screen and it was a perfect picture!  I have been looking for a great camera that was easy and FUN to use and this one has more than I could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera, as Sony always do.Compact, pratice, easy, water proof.If you are looking for a good camera for a good price, this is your camera.Rememended

Reviews.Title: Sony TX-20 a Winner
Reviews.Author: Roger Simister "Rogers"
Reviews.Content: Here's a high quality still camera and a high quality HD video capture device. I especially like the steady shot feature when taking movies,  many shots really look like I used a tripod. I appreciate the on-screen help for camera operation.  I have not yet opened the owners manual. Color reproduction is great,  the HDMI output delivers beautiful video on my 52 inch tv.  I really love a high quality camera that easily fits in my pocket -  I take it everywhere..  I highly recommend this camera to anyone - but be sure to buy an extra battery, you'll need it. for extended trips.

Reviews.Title: Greatest small SONY snapshot camera...Ever..!!
Reviews.Author: Pcprntr
Reviews.Content: I have to say, GOOD JOB SONY..!!  This camera takes phenomenal pictures and movies in all kinds of conditions. Low light, during the day, even during a rain storm. Most situations are covered very well in the camera's automatic setting.  Yes, if you are a 'professional camera enthusiast' you might want more of this and that but for the average picture taker like I am and legions of us are, this is the camera made for us. Check this one out before they are all gone.  The pricing is really affordable for what you get. They are 'on sale' right now.

Reviews.Title: Nice replacement !
Reviews.Author: Ella Okumura
Reviews.Content: I had lost my camera a while ago and was sad they didn't create the same model any longer.Then I found this one which was the newer model. It came so quickly in the mail. Love the picture quality andhow easy it is to use !! Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lots of bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Johnnie Esquivel Piedra
Reviews.Content: I bought this when it was at $150 and was totally worth it, I have used it in pools, ocean, rain without any problems. The touchscreen interface could be a little better, they should make buttons bigger because sometimes you miss the button you want to actually press.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera
Reviews.Author: Tracey G
Reviews.Content: So happy with this camera.  It takes great indoor and outdoor pictures.  We have a SLR camera that we love but is big and bulky, I can keep this one in my purse and it works great.  Went to Ripley's aquarium with it and the lighting is very dim/non existant in places this camera took good quality pictures with vibrant colors.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Best small camera
Reviews.Author: Paul P Pasternak
Reviews.Content: Lets be honest, no small camera will recreate pictures how  dslr type cameras do. They are small for a reason, and thats convenience . Having said that, outdoors this camera takes very nice pictures, indoors takes ok pictures (just like most other compact cameras), but where it shines is with its 1080p recording ability.  This is first camera on the market of its capacity where video recording is top notch. I played with Nikon, canon and others and they don't come close.I wanted a camera where I can take pictures while on vacation but also capture great video without having to bring another piece of equipment. Well this camera does just that.  On top of it, I recorded and took many pictures under water while snorkeling in the ocean and playing with the kids in the pool.There are also other great features like high speed picture capture and panorama capture.The video image stabilization of this second generation model is a great feature as well.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful sturdy camera ...
Reviews.Author: Toonfan
Reviews.Content: Bought this recently to use on a trip to South America and the Antarctic. Its real appeal to me was its stated sturdiness (waterproof, etc.) since I will use it in some pretty trying environments. I must say that this little camera far exceeded my expectations. It takes crisp pictures, even in low light situations. Its biggest strength is in landscape pictures because it has great wide-angle capabilities which I exploited to the fullest in my travel. The two features that really surprised me were (1) panoramic photo capability, and (2) HD videos. At first I had trouble using the panoramic function because I treated it like my iPhone for which I would sweep slowly from left to right. The Sony camera would keep cutting out on me during the pan shot. Then I realized that the Sony required a fast sweep and the pictures were fantastic! The HD recording was easy to do (just press a dedicated button on the camera on and off) and the quality was excellent. During a recording you can also press the regular shutter to grab a snapshot of the recording which turned out to be quite sharp. This camera's waterproof claim was fully tested when I was at Iguazu Falls in Argentina. I was able to record a great video at Devil's Throat with water splashing all around me. All I had to do was wipe off the little lens area (note this camera does not have an external zooming lens) and the camera was good to go. The metallic-like cover also gives the camera a feeling of durability.I do want to point out the main weakness of this camera -- its lack of much zooming power. The optical zoom is only 4x. Sure you can zoom more with the digital zoom, but the quality drops off drastically so it's really not recommended. I tried to stay within the 4x optical zoom and and got good quality there. Overall, I'd say this is the perfect pocket camera for landscape (wide-angle) or moderate distance photos. It'd be a good portable complement to a decent dSLR.

Reviews.Title: Works everywhere!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Jones
Reviews.Content: Just finished Tough Mudder (for those that don't know it is a 12 miles obstacle course through mud) and I carried the camera the whole way with no issues. It handled getting dropped, submerged in ice water and thick muddy water, and covered in dirt and sand. It would start right up every time and take pics quickly and easily, even when my hands were covered in mud. This camera really does work no matter the conditions. I was actually going to get a GoPro and strap that to my head but my wife figured we wouldn't watch the video again (and I would be too lazy to edit the video anyway) but now we have pics of our team at the obstacles and having fun.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, everything on the photographic side is relatively easy to use.  The only downside is that it doesn't come with a separate battery charger, it's built in, so you have to plug the camera into the wall. It would be preferable to have a spare battery so it can be charging while you are using the camera and being able to swap batteries for events like weddings etc.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality...
Reviews.Author: M. Kalagias
Reviews.Content: I am truly impressed, the quality this little camera is capable of is absolutely astounding...I will be updating this review in the future as my main purpose for buying this camera is for underwater photography in the ocean but my initial tests just to make sure this model will take decent pictures above water let alone below are so astounding I felt I had to share and words alone can't do it so I have uploaded some pictures I took through my windshield using this camera while driving 70mph and most of these pics are take with me just quickly pressing the shutter button with the camera balanced on the steering wheel (See customer images in the listing for the camera to see pictures).Another noteworthy feature is this camera passed my battery stress test with flying colors... I took about 200 shots with the flash off, another 75 with the flash on, and then took 10 minutes of video at the highest quality setting before I gave up trying to run the battery out... it still had 1/2 power left according to indicator but even if that was not really accurate (I sometimes find battery meters on devices will plummet quite suddenly) that is an impressive amount of shooting.I also tested the video quality while moving at 70mph, I have uploaded a video to YouTube with the result, you can easily find it by searching for "MKXios DSC-TX20"As to testing underwater so far all I have done is test in a local hotel pool, the pictures and underwater video were good, but it's was indoor pool, well lit, in a new/clean hotel so the environment did not have much "character" to it to gets shots of.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: ROHIT
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera from sony, i love it.Good quality HD pictures , with CMOS lens.Best part is shockproof, it fell twice but still worked perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Camera with a TON of Features
Reviews.Author: S. Allen
Reviews.Content: I'm a helicopter pilot in the Navy and wanted a durable camera to take on deployments that would produce good pictures while standing up to the rigors of life out to sea.  Most of the ones I looked at were bulky or awkward looking and then I found this Sony on sale at Amazon and decided it might fit the bill.First off, the camera itself is beautiful!  Very sleek.  Because the cover slides shut over the lens, flash, and microphones it slips easily into and out of my pocket so I can carry it with me and never miss a shot.  The build quality seems to be extremely high with a very solid feel to the sliding cover.The pictures it takes are great.  I have to say that I'm not a professional photographer by any stretch so I'm probably not nearly as critical about my pictures as some might be.  That being said, I have no problems with the results I get from this camera in just about any lighting situation.  The plethora of pre-loaded settings and scenes offered by the TX20 mean that I can get the perfect shot every time.  The interface of the included PC software makes loading photos to my laptop extremely quick and easy.Finally, the touchscreen is awesome!  Very responsive and puts all of the commands right at my fingertips in an orderly, easy to understand format.  I would definitely buy this camera again and recommend it to anyone who's in the market for a tough, beautiful way to take pictures on the go.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for underwater
Reviews.Author: j
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a trip to the Caribbean. This camera works great underwater and has lots of options for difference scenes. The picture quality isn't as good but worth it to take underwater.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Sujung18
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it was on sale for 149.99 and glad I got it. The camera is originally about $399 and thought that was too much. This camera is awesome and touch screen. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because it doesn't come with a memory card at all.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great steal because of the price I got it for ($150). I would not pay the full price for this camera though.Pros:Lots of modes so you don't have to think about settings, awesome pics. Bit of a learning curve to learn the UI because my last cybershot was ancient, but I like it. Slim (some people/ men are complaining it's too slim, but that's a big plus to me)Cons:1. sometimes the screen seems unresponsive at the first tap2. the playback/ picture review mode could be a lot better. I'd love to just be able to pick a viewing mode with or without picture info and just scroll through my shots by swiping the screen3. I was pretty excited to go take underwater shots until I read all the part about servicing the camera yearly to change the waterproof seals for the ports.... no thanks.So if you see this selling for $150 again, definitely go for it! But I suspect you won't think you've gotten value for money if you paid full price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: I hadn't had an actual camera in a few years but I was going to Hawaii and wanted a good camera fro the trip. I chose this camera so I could use it underwater. This camera did not disappoint! I was hiking, swimming, snorkeling, paddle boarding, and what not all week and it never skipped a beat. I did make sure to rinse it with freshwater and dry it off after every use in water but it worked perfectly. Surprisingly the pictures underwater did come out looking very clear. You can't really see the screen on the phone so it's more of a shoot and hope thing underwater but just take lots of pics and you can delete the bad ones. My brother used a camera inside a special waterproof bag specially made for cameras and my pics were twice as clear. Oh yea and taking pics out of the water worked great too. The camera has a sensor that determines what style of pic you are taking (landscape, people, etc) and adjusts accordingly. Plus since it's 16 mp of course the pics look great! I couldn't be happier with this camera. Def buy it for an all around good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: MN Swede
Reviews.Content: This was Amazon's Deal of the Day a week before Christmas, and at the $149.99 price, I couldn't resist. The thing I like most is the small size. It's so light and thin that you can slip it in your front pocket and not even know it's there. Nice for those times when you don't want to lug around a big SLR camera. The photos are surprisingly good, with nice colors and sharp focus. I tried a few shots under water in the pool, and those look great too. Just make sure you change the menu settings to the "underwater" mode - that adjusts the color balance so your photos look more natural. The battery has pretty good power too. I shot around 200 images one day, about 1/3 with flash, and still had battery left at the end of the day. If I had one nit to pick, it would be that you have to be careful of your fingers when you are holding it, because of it's small size, Since the entire back of the camera is a touch screen, it's easy to accidentally get into the menu mode, or change settings, if you're not careful. Also, the lens is in the upper left corner, so you have to pay attention to where your finger is when shooting. Certainly not a deal-breaker, just something to be aware of. All-in-all a great little camera, and I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for vacation, but used daily!
Reviews.Author: V. Ward
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera when it went on sale as a "Gold Box" deal. My husband and I were leaving the toddler behind, and going on a weekend "mini vacation" the next day, so I read a few reviews, was happy with what I read, and had the camera overnighted to us so we could take it with us the next day. We received the camera, my husband charged it, and off we went.The camera charged in a reasonable amount of time. The charger is a USB on one end, which is convenient because you can plug it into car chargers, your computer, or into a wall charger, but the end that plugs into the camera is a special end only used by Sony. This sort of annoyed me, because it meant I would need to have yet another charger to carry around with me. I tend to prefer electronics that can be charged with a micro USB charger like my cell phone, HP Touchpad, and Kindle Fire all do.We first used this camera to take a few test shots of our hotel room. I was impressed with the speed of the camera. It turns on and is ready to take a picture very quickly. It doesn't take long for it to snap a picture, and most of the time, the pictures come out perfectly fine.We used the camera several times on our trip, and overall we were impressed with the pictures it took. We normally use a DSLR, so we are used to very high quality pictures, and obviously a compact camera just can't get the same quality you get from a full-framed camera, but the pictures this camera takes is good enough for capturing memories. The quality does tend to suffer in low-light situations - they can come out very noisy, and it has trouble focusing properly in low light. The quality also suffers when zooming in more than a couple notches - the more you zoom in, the worse the quality gets. This was expected, however, so it wasn't an earth-shattering disappointment.Before I forget, I do also want to note that the camera does not default to the highest resolution picture settings. It is very easy to change, but I didn't realize this until after we had taken a few pictures, so when you get the camera, make sure to change the settings so it's on the highest resolution setting.We also took this camera underwater on our mini vacation trip. It was just in the hotel swimming pool, so there were no amazing underwater scenes to capture to truly determine the underwater quality of this camera, however it took decent enough pictures of my husband and I underwater, and it is a fun little feature to play around with. I expect it'll be great to have once my daughter starts swimming this coming summer.Since our vacation, this camera has gotten more use than I originally expected it to when I first purchased it. It is so much more convenient to have this in my pocket instead of lugging my big DSLR around, so I find I'm taking more pictures of my daughter playing than I was before. They aren't as great quality, but for pictures to upload on Facebook for all the relatives, they are good enough.I've also been using this camera to take pictures of items I'm selling on eBay. I find that it makes it a lot easier to get the pictures than using my bigger camera, and so I'm more inclined to actually bother listing and selling things, whereas it was something I would put off before because I didn't feel like dragging my camera out.Overall, this camera is pretty good for a little point-and-shooter camera. It isn't professional-quality by no means, but for the amateur photographer who wants to take pictures of family, or get some cool shots of underwater scenes, etc. this is a great camera. If you are looking for something to take great pictures in low-light, or to take high-speed pictures of sports, etc., I'd probably not bother investing in this.

Reviews.Title: Rugged but...
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera during the Gold Box Deal of the Day ($164 after taxes).Pros- Many functions and mode choices: underwater shooting, panorama, etc.- Great for beach/water-related outingsCon- Battery seem to drain quickly, especially with underwater function- Processing time of photos creates lag between shots- Focus is sometimes off and create blurred images

Reviews.Title: it does everything it says on the box
Reviews.Author: edfuh "ed"
Reviews.Content: this was a present for someone and he loved it so I guess it's good. I need five more words.

Reviews.Title: love my camera
Reviews.Author: hylo
Reviews.Content: Living in Oregon I must be prepared to deal with rain so I have always had my eye on this camera.  Finding this last year at $150 made my day.  I could not be happier with the picture quality.  The smile detection is amusing and I really like the ability to take a series of pictures in less then a second.  Macro focus works exceptionally well compared to my last cybershot.  Taking pictures in low light without a flash works surprisingly well.  I like how the camera turns itself on and off when you slide the front cover.My only issue with the camera so far has been due to the placement of the lens where I tend to hold the camera being left handed.  Often I see my finger in the shots.  I have also occasionally hit something on the touch screen when trying to take a picture.  Its a tricky camera to hold on to and very tiny.  I think I will be investing in a mini tripod and learning to hold my camera differently.

Reviews.Title: Best deal ever!
Reviews.Author: Christian Dawson
Reviews.Content: I caught this on sale for $149. Immediately bought 3. Sony has not let me down with the quality of this piece. I replaced an older TX-5. This one is smaller and with the freeze/drop/dust/water proof capabilities I do not feel nervous at all when I throw it in my pocket to go out. I have never been let down by the TX Line of cameras. I have taken these offroading in the desert, snorkeling in salt water and on 2 trips around the world worry-free. This takes very high quality photos and the battery life is great. I recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and nice pics
Reviews.Author: Micah Hart, author of 'Tinseland'
Reviews.Content: Bought this before Christmas as i got tired of my just ok photos with iphone.  camera worked well and takes clear photos close up and far away, even with full zoom (which can sometimes distort the pics).  definitely get a memory card with purchase or you can only take a couple pictures before camera full.  It also has several features for different effects (but limited), and software for loading onto computers.  but mainly i wanted a camera i can take around, not worry about it getting wet, and simple to use.  Glad I made the purchase.  UPDATE: 7/2013  Have used the camera for a while now.  Still works great.  We take it to the pool all the time and get some great underwater shots.  No issues to date.

Reviews.Title: sweet
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: use the camera to shoot product images for work and use for personal camera also,love the green color, very durable, easy to use,the thing kicks ass!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Lane
Reviews.Content: I have a previous version of the camera, which has been great, so it didn't take much convincing to buy this newer version for my fiance. She has since used it on hikes in both the US and Iceland, as well as for everyday activities, and it has worked wonderfully. The various filter settings allow for some fun photos as well. This camera hasn't been used under water yet, but if it works as well as mine does, it will be great for scuba diving. Overall, this is a fun camera that is durable and takes great quality pics.

Reviews.Title: takes a lickin', keeps on clickin'
Reviews.Author: Hugger of Trees "Ricardo"
Reviews.Content: So far I've taken the camera out into the waves on big surf days several times. It takes great shots, as well as wonderful video. One bit of advice for users of this camera- make sure you get your fingers out of the way of the lens when you're bodysurfing- of course that it easier said than done. But, if you can do that, the camera can capture some really fun images. I gave it four stars because I think it still has room for improved functionality, particularly with respect to the touch screen in the water. But really, how much touch screen sensitivity is it fair to ask for when you're out in the surf?

Reviews.Title: its a good little camera so far
Reviews.Author: prisy
Reviews.Content: i took the camera to boston and in the ocean ,and it feels uncomfortable putting it in the water but it worked, no leaks so far, it seems to be a pretty good camera and the photos came out very clear and almost perfessional.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Saldana "lins2116"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband's trip to Sturgis. It offers so many great features and great resolution BUT still incredibly easy to use! Just pop it in your pocket for quick and easy access. He loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera no doubt ! ! ! All what I wanted...
Reviews.Author: Tomas Nakazato "tomnaka"
Reviews.Content: This camera is all what I wanted:- Small and light.- Waterproof, dustproof, shockproof.- Great pictures.- Full HD videos.- Touchscreen.- Fast turn on.- Panorama.- And more features that I am still discovering...!I had previously an Olympus Tough, and I must admit that this one is a lot better. The Olympus looks great too, but it is bigger and heavier, does not have a touchscreen and most important, it takes more time to turn on (very important when you want to catch THE precise picture...)This is a camera for a regular family with little kids who wants to take photos for vacations (specially at the beach, cruises and waterparks). NO worries about dust, sand, water, falls, etc... Places where I CAN NOT take my smartphone with me to take the views. Great!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent travel camera
Reviews.Author: Socko
Reviews.Content: This camera has awesome picture and video quality. Dust proof, water proof, and shock proofIs absolutly a must for hardcore travelers. I have 2 issues with the camera and that is the screen when you are shooting pictures is small and the camera is small for my big fingers and they get in my picture sometimes.

Reviews.Title: Sony should be ashamed.
Reviews.Author: pvanecek
Reviews.Content: I buy Sony because I have bought it for the last 12 years and 3 cameras.  I loved all my old Cyber Shots.  This one takes great pix, and fantastic videos.  But I only owned it 2 months before it broke-died.  It got water inside and it could not be fixed.  I didn't open the battery door around water.  I didn't drop it, I didn't abuse it -all things Sony accused me of doing.  Shame on you Sony for making an inferior product and then not standing behind your name.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase this camera!
Reviews.Author: Brian Park
Reviews.Content: This "water proof" camera broke after one trip to the beach.  I had the camera in my board short pocket while I paddle boarded.  The only time the camera was actually under water was while I walked the board out to get on it.  The battery dropped rapidly and it went out completely.  I sent it into Sony to fix it since I had only had it for one month.  They called and told me that there was internal damage and it was my fault.  They sent the defective unit back to me.  I spoke with multiple people in customer service department and they all said there's nothing they can do. If you can't take a water proof camera to paddle boarding, it's not waterproof!  Do not purchase this product. Terrible product and even worse customer service.  I'm never purchasing anything Sony after this encounter.

Reviews.Title: A great waterproof camera, but not the camera to buy for the critical eye.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Pantliano "The Photo Guy"
Reviews.Content: The Sony TX20 is a nice all around package with the added bonus of being waterproof.  If top photo quality is your main priority, you're not going to find it here, however.First let me preface the rest of this review by stating that I already owned the previous version of this camera, the TX10, and I'll be mentioning the old camera from time to time in the review.In appearance the TX20 is striking, especially in the orange and gray combination that I have.  One very nice detail is the brick pattern embossed into the sliding lens cover.  The camera very small and will slip into a pocket with ease.  Despite its small size it's very solid feeling, with a metal front.  It has a nice heft in the hand, and the materials are all high quality and well assembled.Using the TX20 is a breeze.  There are only a few buttons on the camera; power, shutter, zoom level, playback mode, and the movie record button.  These buttons are quite tiny, but I had no problem using them with my average sized hands.  The large and high-resolution touch screen manipulates all other camera functions.  The touch screen on the TX20 is very responsive, much better than the TX10.  One huge disappointment is that the screen does not work underwater, so make sure you set the camera up before you get it wet.The TX20 is loaded with features.  There is the automatic mode (which does all of the thinking for you), a plethora of scene modes to choose from, and for those who prefer a little more control there is program mode.  One feature I appreciate is the custom white balance setting.  The sweep panorama is a great feature and works flawlessly about 70% of the time.  For those who don't know, with sweep panorama you simply rotate slowly while the camera shoots photos and stitches them together automatically.  Another useful mode is HDR, this takes three photos in a row and meshes them together so you can capture both the highlights and shadows, and it works well.  Lastly, the lens features an optical image stabilizer to reduce blurry photos and help with shooting in low light.The Sony is a very speedy camera too.  Once you flick down the sliding lens cover, it is ready to go in about 3 seconds.  It focuses in about 1 second and is ready to take the next photo almost instantly.  In continuous shooting mode you can take up to 10 full resolution photos at 10 frames per second, which is a real boon for capturing fast action.So far the Sony has a lot going for it, but where it disappoints is in critical photo quality.  Even at the lowest ISO setting details are a bit soft and some photos look more like a watercolor painting than a photo.  Once the ISO speeds start to raise things get even worse as details are completely obliterated.  On the plus side, even at high ISO speeds colors stay vivid and there is very little noise in the images (since it's all being mushed away), and focus, exposure, and color are excellent most of the time.  I find that prints over 5' x 7' that have a lot of fine details in them look a little soft, but I am very picky.  If you're going to make the majority of your prints smaller than 8' x 10' and aren't as picky about critical image quality than I'm sure you'll like the stylish and fun TX20 just fine.  The lens starts at a very wide 24mm so it's easy to fit everyone in the picture or capture sweeping landscapes.  Additionally, the lens does not soften much in the corners.The Sony's movie mode is excellent.  It records full high definition video with stereo sound and the ability to use the optical zoom.  Moreover, while recording a move, you can take a full resolution still image as well, and it doesn't interrupt the movie.As far as ruggedness is concerned, I used the old TX10 at many water parks and pools and never had any issues with water getting into the camera.  I tried the TX20 in water as well and it didn't give me any trouble.  The doors have nice tight seals.  Additionally the TX10 was dropped a few times on concrete and always survived, and while I'm hoping to never drop the TX20, it's nice to know it can take it in stride.  One note about waterproofing is to make sure all the seals are clean of debris and closed tightly, also make sure that when you’re done in the water that you soak the camera in clean tap water for 10 minutes and press all the buttons to clean out any contaminants.All in all...cameras and water don't usually mix, but the TX20 plays in the water just fine.

Reviews.Title: Perfect waterproof camera!!
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!! It takes amazing photos and works quickly to take the pictures right as you snap them. I took lots of pictures at Niagara Falls, even on the Maid of the Mist boat where the mist was like a rain storm. The camera had no problems being soaked with water but I would recommend wiping water drops off the lens if you are taking pictures in the rain or snow. The zoom works really well, panoramic shooting and other features come in handy. This camera also has a thin, sleek design so you can easily fit it in your pocket or purse. If you're looking for a waterproof camera, this one is worth every penny!! I also bought the SanDisk Extreme HD Video 16 GB SDHC Class 10 Memory Card (SDSDRX3-016G-A21) and Fujifilm Dual Connect Float Camera Strap to go with it.

Reviews.Title: Not water proof
Reviews.Author: Dwayne Garcia
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for myself for Christmas....its takes some outstanding pic,,,,,but I Neva did get the option of using the water feature. I recently just did and guess what yup u guessed it killed my camera in 3ft. Of water for less than 10 min no expert can tell me different cause I'm fully capable of using a camera this camera killed my trip I wanted some pic in the water with the family and it just checked out on me...instant killer.....I hate Sony for this Neva again people...neva

Reviews.Title: WOW! Simply amazing for this price...
Reviews.Author: Marx
Reviews.Content: After going through 2 Olympus "Tough" cameras, I decided to go with this sale-priced Sony because I was tired of throwing my money away. I do a lot of adventure travel and the cameras broke quite easily under less than ideal conditions. Paying $400 for a camera that lasts less than a year is stupid.Much to my surprise, the lower-priced Sony completely put Olympus to shame. The quality, technology and ease of use packed into this little Sony is simply amazing. I would be just as happy at the original retail price...The quick on feature means extremely few missed shots, the low light features are outstanding without having to work your way through cumbersome menus and the easy to use and easy to see touch screen means no more fumbling in the dark to find the right buttons to get to the scene settings. (very few missed shots like I frequently had with the Olympi).The "intelligent" auto setting is truly intelligent and I rarely have to use any other settings. The panoramic feature works seamlessly and processes in mere seconds. (Again, unlike the Olympus... panoramas looked like crap and took forever to process).The only funny thing (for me) is I had to go to "youtube" where they actually had videos posted of people opening their TX20's upon delivery LOL... to figure out what a little plastic piece was in the box that had no explanation in the instruction book... It's a touch-screen wand that snaps onto the wristband...I recommend that you also buy the external recharger with a spare battery or two, (inexpensive non-proprietary options available), to allow the camera to fully dry out before opening the sealed cover to recharge the battery, and a brightly colored floating wrist strap. BTW: even battery life is better :-)Occasionally I'll accidentally touch something on the screen and have no idea where I am in the advanced menu settings... easy answer... just close the slide cover and reopen and it will bring you back to the mode you were using before in about a second.I grew up 100% loyal to Olympus and never thought I would use another brand (4 decades of only using Olympus). I don't want to sound like I'm dissing them, but their transition from film to digital is lame at best (at least in this category of camera) and I can't believe how much better the Sony is in comparison.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed and sending back
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: Really really wanted to love this camera. It's small, light and looks nice. Feels sturdy too and I like the color. And, it has lots of nice features and of course is water proof. Unfortunately I didn't find the quality to be there with the photos; it's as simple as that.The underwater photos were fine and totally acceptable. And everything else is acceptable...but just not as good and crisp as other small cameras I've had.I do agree with some of the comments that have already been written. Due to the placement of the lens, you get a lot of fingers in photos. I found this happened when I handed my camera to someone else to take a photo and they weren't used to it.The biggest issue is there is no viewfinder and the screen isn't bright enough to use when outside in bright daylight. So I would end up just guessing on the framing, which is not what you want to be doing when you are visiting one of the "Wonders of the World."Also, upon reviewing I found several photos with soft focus. Sure, there could be some "operator error" involved, but I've never had a problem with focus before and as someone who works in TV for a living, I'm pretty tech savvy. I think it had to do with what object in the frame the device was focusing on.Overall, while I like the idea of the touchscreen for controls, I found that I missed the more traditional camera controls so I'm returning the camera. If you want something small and cool to take pics for facebook and don't need great quality, it will be fine. If you demand a bit more control and quality I'd search for a different option. Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: Has everything but image quality
Reviews.Author: Enki
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and comparisons for this camera and decided to trust the high ratings. Well, sad to report it's a disappointment. The camera is great in every respect except the image quality. Just came back from a vacation and was startled to realize the pics look like they were taken with a smartphone. If you're looking for small photos for your smartphone this will suffice, but if you're looking for pictures that you can blow up or zoom in on, this is the wrong camera for you. I wish I didn't waste my money on this.

Reviews.Title: Worked great...for exactly one year.
Reviews.Author: Rachel R. Wright
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on my birthday in 2013 and used it frequently as I traveled throughout Mexico.  The pictures were very good and the waterproof feature worked great.  Then, on my birthday in 2014, it got wet and, though it was properly sealed and attended to, the water seeped into the battery compartment and the camera was ruined.Basically, this is a lovely camera but has a limited lifespan.  I was very disappointed.  I could not replace it in Mexico (electronics are very expensive there) and lost hundreds of photos because the memory card was also ruined.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, only wish the color I order came instead of the black I got!
Reviews.Author: Vinnfizz "Vinnfizz"
Reviews.Content: Previously had the DSC TX10, was damaged so I ordered this one as an upgrade to what I had. Does all it claims to do and very similar operation to the previous.My only problem is I thought I ordered the camera in blue as pictured but it showed up in black. Due to an upcoming vacation I had no time to return prior leaving on our trip. It's only a small inconvenience and doesn't affect the operations at all, just harder to find when I lay it down somewhere or put it in my black pacpack.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for everyday carry
Reviews.Author: E. Plaga
Reviews.Content: I carry a camera everywhere. I needed a waterproof, schockproof camera to hold up to camping, swimming, and just everyday use. This does. Have used it swimming, waterparks, camping, dropped it a few times. No matter, it takes great pictures. At first, I had to play with the settings since my pics were a little out of focus. After educating myself, I was able to get great results under good lighting. When it's very dark, not so much. It has it's limitations. But it fits my regular needs. Would absolutely buy againOne bit of important FYI: The video is in a AVCHD format. Which means it isn't a simple transfer to DVD for TV viewing. It is a more complex process and viewing requires a Blueray after. The videos can be watched immediately on the PC though. I am still looking into a way to get these converted for TV viewing, but it requires an app to do so, then burning it on a DVD which is then shown using a Blueray. So now, I use this for stills and video I am OK with having on the PC and leave the family video to the camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: I love this little thing! It takes good shots and the fact that it's waterproof makes it fun whenever you're near a pool. Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Sorry Sony but this sucks...
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I used to have a sony cybershot TX-5 for more than 3 years without ANYY problems, until the focus started to give me problems, so I decided to change it for a new model. I used it all the time and it was great, very durable and reliable for EVERYTHING.After I received the TX20, I didn't use it much. Last month I started to use it and noticed a crack on the battery entry lit, but didn't mind it. I thought it could have been my fault. This weekend though, I used it and broke alongside the screen, and in the battery lit. This crack was really big, so it is no longer waterproof.In conclusion, in a 3 week period of seldom usage and not dropping it on hard surfaces, the camera is wrecked. This came as a shock since the last one that I had(TX5) withstander much worse situation during a very loooong period.This led me to believe that there might be something wrong with the camera that I received. Not necessarily with the TX20, there might be a chance, since the negative reviews are so few (although, I now noticed, the negative ones relate to this same issue).I would advise to buy a previous model if what you are looking for is a durable and reliable camara.I'm calling SONY to see if there is something to do. I'll keep you posted.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: theCURE
Reviews.Content: I like that its waterproof and slim but photos are just not that great. If you want quality photos,look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size and waterproof
Reviews.Author: texaspablo
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly what I was looking for.  A pocket size and wrist wearable camera that is waterproof.  I took this to a water amusement park and it held up well and to a swimming pool and no problems with it.  I always double check the seals to make sure that they are on securely.  There are some things I don't like but it wasn't as big of a factor.  First, the pictures are not as crisp as I would like them and that's probably because they cover the lens to make it waterproof.  Not a big deal if you're using this around water but I wouldn't use this if I wanted to take great pictures.  The other item is that screen is prone to scratches.  I wound up getting an iphone screen protector to protect the screen.  Last, the flash is very weak but again, not a camera if you are planning on taking great pictures.  Overall, it's a good product that fits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Failed on its first dip in water.
Reviews.Author: Neil Sankar
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to go on my once in a lifetime honeymoon to Bora Bora and on the first day, first dip in water, less than 2 feet down the screen went blank and it never came back on.  This malfunction left me without a camera on one of my most memorable trips.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA OR ANY "WATERPROOF" CAMERA BY SONY
Reviews.Author: Deborah L Hill
Reviews.Content: My wife purchased this camera for me as a gift to take on an occasional snorkeling trip. I used it once on a trip to Hawaii and it worked fine. Then about 4 months later I used it on a trip to St. John. I was very careful to follow the instructions for making sure everything was sealed (you really can't mess it up unless you have one of the sockets hanging open). The second time I used it (third overall), I started getting streaks on the image on the screen. It never worked after that. There was no damage or anything out of place on the camera. It was only about 6 months old and still covered under warranty. I sent it to the Sony repair facility in Texas. I received a call that the problem was corrosion and that was not covered under the warranty???? WHAT? You buy a camera that is advertised to be waterproof. You use it as directed. It leaks. It becomes corroded inside and it isn't covered by the warranty. Why would you buy it? This seems like a scam and I am going to report it to some consumer protection agency, although I doubt it will do any good.

Reviews.Title: no complaints...
Reviews.Author: readernut
Reviews.Content: good performer overall. The only downside is that the battery drains quickly, and the battery meter seems a bit unreliable at times. I just carry a USB backup charger that I also use for my phone....

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've ever bought
Reviews.Author: Danny Will
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 6 months now and put it threw water sand and everything in between and it's held up.

Reviews.Title: Good photos, bad video, bad low light
Reviews.Author: Robert Kenneth Perlstein
Reviews.Content: Focusing the lens is a big problem. It never really wants to work. Especially in video mode, it prefers peripheral objects close to the camera over center objects. NO centered weighted average seems to be available.My Samsung S4 phone takes better video 75% of the time! The only decent part is image stabilization, but that's to be expected.Photos seem to be good quality, if they can focus. Burst mode seems to have trouble focusing. 4x zoom is very low, but this is expected as the camera does not have a protruding lens.Touch screen is a horrible interface.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: S. Pauli
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an outdoorsy camera to replace my old waterproof Fujifilm that I loved, but it didn't have the best shooting options and had no lens protection.I love all the features of this camera. Touch-focus, panoramic, color select, etc... tons of stuff to play around with or get serious with.The sliding front is very thin and I'll be more careful with this than I was with my more rugged Fujifilm, but I'm more than happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: It survived the middle east!
Reviews.Author: R. Debonise
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my father to use while he was deployed to the middle east.  He used it almost daily and subjected it to more punishment than it was probably meant to take.  He has been back for a few months now and still loves this camera and uses it often!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Donna K Vliet
Reviews.Content: Received just in time for my cruise. It was great to have this for my climb up Dunn's River Falls in Jamaica! I love all the features that this camera has to offer.

Reviews.Title: The Camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon L Whitebread
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome pics as I have had several cyber shot cameras in the past this is the best one yet... I am not a big fan of Sony customer service, but Amazon service is Awesome...

Reviews.Title: damaged and used item given as a new item
Reviews.Author: roald ramkissoon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item and when the package was opened it was damaged with cracks and the writing on the cam was coming off straight out the box this is the worst and most dishonest thing a company can do and I cannot return the piece of crap because I am not living in the us and I would not be up there for another 8 months

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: User1
Reviews.Content: I had this one in grey for myself. So I got this for my sister in law, and she just simply loved it.It's very handy and has very good picture quality with different settings, including the panorama (my personal favourite).This also comes with a small touch stick that could be hung to the tag which I find really cool.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: Bought this right before my trip to europe and it was a great savior to me. I took lots of pictures, literally thousands, and its battery lasted me all day without a problem. Also it's waterproof which is useful, although i've been too afraid to test that out.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Milissa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over a year ago and its still going strong.  I have a very high end Canon camera that takes amazing photos but its super bulky and not easy to carry along with two small children.  I was looking for a camera that would go in my pocket and easily record video primarily but also take candid shots without the hassle of a camera bag.  I love this camera!  I was afraid to get it wet when I first got it but I have used this everywhere.  The camera is actually not bad.  The video is perfect for what I wanted.  Quality enough without hassle.  I love being able to take it to the beach or pool or springs and having it in the water with me.  I have taken some amazing shots of my kids in the water with this.  If and when this one finally breaks I will certainly buy another.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Ailec Pichardo Toral
Reviews.Content: Just loving the camera, I can take it anywhere, I can take pictures of anything now.  I can even lend it to my boy, who loves taking pictures!  So many possibilities for pictures.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Camera - Horrible Lens
Reviews.Author: Stew
Reviews.Content: It's clear Sony knew they pooped the bed with this model with the massive price drop. I didn't care though, I needed an outdoor camera and this was a great price for what I needed. If you are looking for good quality photos that you can blow up to 8.5 x 11, get the next model.

Reviews.Title: One year review.
Reviews.Author: polloinka
Reviews.Content: Pro: great features, take nice pictures, love the touchscreen, face tracking and sweep panorama modeCons: very, very fragile, some parts of the case are made of cheap plastic that will crack easily and Sony won't honor the warranty, saying that the warranty doesn't cover unintentional physical damages. They claim that the camera is shockproof, but what is the point of being shockproof if it cracks without ever being dropped? Waterproof? Maybe. I didn't had the chance to test it underwater, since the 1st cracked appeared only 2 months after I got the camera.In total, I had to send it back 3x, the 1st time they replaced it for free, no questions asked. The 2nd and 3rd time they told me that the warranty didn't cover unintentional physical damage.I see that many other reviewers had the same issue, and Sony won't even consider that the design and material have a problem. So buyer beware.Bottom line: I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product highly recommended
Reviews.Author: Rafael Valera
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great buy, good resolution, quality and performance, excellent capture images in day and night, videos are also recorded in very good resolution, audio from them is a little low but it is normal in these items ...

Reviews.Title: LOVE it
Reviews.Author: Haili
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for over a year now, and I really dont have ANY complaints about it. Love the fact that its waterproof. It takes GREAT pictures and its small and easy to take with me anywhere. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a compact camera that takes GREAT quality pictures. No regrets after purchasing this camera, over a year ago.

Reviews.Title: It works!
Reviews.Author: Angela 801
Reviews.Content: I like that I can take pictures in unique dimensions, but the battery life sucks! I got it as a gift for my fiance so that he can take pictures with style on his fishing ventures. Although, The unibody design looks and feel is great.

Reviews.Title: Will never purchase a Sony Product again!
Reviews.Author: Jean Kobryn
Reviews.Content: Have to admit, I loved the camera the first two times I used it for snorkeling.  Never got to use it a third time.  The camera Malfunctioned from a manufacturers defect within the first week and Sony would not honor my warranty.  Accused me of mishandling the camera when I followed the instructions.  This was a big purchase for me, and planned on getting much use from this since I live on a Caribbean island so I treated it with extra special care but it didn't matter.  I now have it as a display in my beach front shop so the tourists know what NOT to buy!

Reviews.Title: Incredible thinking
Reviews.Author: Kyei Nuako
Reviews.Content: This camera is so nice and so cute everyone that see me with it loves it, I chose this lime color because its different

Reviews.Title: Decent compact camera
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: The size is awesome. The battery life is decent. The pictures are nice and clear. However, the ONLY reason I bought this camera was for the underwater feature.....yes it is waterproof....but the underwater pictures are terrible! So much so that I purchased a different camera for my next Caribbean vacation.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Marijo Ulloa
Reviews.Content: It takes excellent pictures! It works very well underwater and out of water! I've tried it on the beach and in a pool and the pictures turn out very nice!

Reviews.Title: Good camera - much better than other waterproof point and shoots
Reviews.Author: Cycleman
Reviews.Content: I started out with a Nikon AW100 - low light sucked, speed sucked, time between shots sucked.  I returned that and got this sony.  Very happy with it.  Performs good underwater.  It seems like sony built a camera and then made it waterproof.....other manufacturers put the camera part second.  One thing though - is that the body is slippery....definitely put a wrist strap on it.  The size is GREAT!  Recharge time after using the flash could be a little faster.  Overall a great little waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Francisco Galárraga
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic. Nice and small, waterproof, and it's automatic settings actually take really good, crisp shots. I normally used to haul out my Sony Alpha A57 with a couple of lenses, but since I purchased this, I actually don't worry and just slip this baby into my pocket, cause it serves it's purpose in most situations (most of which end up in family albums or in facebook albums either way, not professional work). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: recommended!
Reviews.Author: Lina Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Small and compact. Love the color. It's waterproof and comes w other functions. Ive had it for over a year and no problems at all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: One of my best cameras
Reviews.Author: AMK
Reviews.Content: gopro, sony HDR action cams? You know what? this is also an option.I have been using these DSC cameras since 2006 starting with DSC-T5. With this version, I recorded videos at six flags water park, I'm recording snowboarding, and diving videos. This is one little great camera.I just ordered sony cyber-shot dsc-tx30 to see how it is like. I'm a big fan of this little camera. Buying a Cyber-shot DSC camera is no brainer!

Reviews.Title: Camera for vacation
Reviews.Author: Douglas R. Hudspeth
Reviews.Content: My daughter used it scuba diving on a cruise, pictures were fantastic. Not a bad price but is a quality camera, I own 2

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jan Degeest
Reviews.Content: Good quality video's easy to use camera. I bought it for surveys and photo's/video's of equipment to help me with reporting. For the size and the price it offers good value.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pictures, Don't Use it Underweater
Reviews.Author: MW Khazragui
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures & normally wide angle. When I took it underwater, it always leaks water into the battery compartment, miraculously, I was able to dry it out without damage.  Kept the camera for its great pictures and compactness, NOT TAKING IT UNDERWATER.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen S. "gospursgo10"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to Europe and the pics came out amazing.  My older model Sony camera always blurred and came out with spots whenever I would zoom in but this one doesn't do it at all.  The video feature comes in handy and the quality of the pictures I took came out better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: LoveAllThingsAmazon
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  It is very small but it takes great pictures.  I also love the underwater feature.  I leave it on easy mode most of the time and I end up with great shots.  I have used the video feature many times too.  I love that I can keep it in my purse and pull it out in a jiffy.  I also love that it doesn't take long for it to power on so I can capture moments in a flash.  I dropped my first Sony Cyber-shot and broke the battery compartment door.  I bought another one just like it because I love it so much.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: SAC "Staise"
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in great shape and takes nice photos for a point and shoot.  It is very compact.  It fits into a pocket and is not much bigger than my phone.  It has several creative settings to capture images as black and white, sepia, painting-like, and many more.  I haven't  taken it into the water yet, but if you do make sure you purchase a separate water-proof container for it.  I bought the Polaroid one and the camera fits in it well.  I am able to depress the shutter button without too much trouble while in the water-proof case.  Everything leaks.  Water will always find a way in, but if you have the outer case, the mere trickle of water that gets into the case will not damage the interior of the camera.  I had a Sony waterproof camera before this one that died on me my first time taking it snorkeling while on vacation.  i  won't let that happen again.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: E. Hagan "Xweetie"
Reviews.Content: Sony almost always produces reliable products.  This is no exception.  I had just put my previous one thru the washer in the pocket of my jeans.  :((  So I was looking for something more water resistant and able to take minor falls.  I also wanted something that was not the same old, boring matt black color.I love: the bright color, the slide panel/ON, voice activated snap, and Zoom control.  But it is the touch screen controls and automatic focussing/lighting sensors that definitely make this work for me!  So far I haven't had to resort to the manual (8>O) to get quite good pictures most of the time.I still am confusing the ON/OFF button with the picture snap one, and getting my fingers in the way of shots.  :((  I also wish I'd paid more attention to the lesser zoom magnification this one has to my previous camera.  As with my new "smart" phone, the need for much more frequent recharging is dismaying.  However, since I am a casual photographer, I am overall very happy with this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: deserves five stars "kmr1015"
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks... clear photos and easy to use.  I have more expensive cameras which I gave away after receiving this compact camera.  It worked wonderfully in the ocean and pool as well as in a wide variety of settings.  We dropped it once on a hike yet it endured without difficulty.  An important note is to follow the directions which include rinsing it off in fresh water after you use it in the ocean.  We did and have had no difficulties.  This is a nifty little camera for casual use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent if you need an underwater camera.
Reviews.Author: M. Castelazo "cyberlat"
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have choosen a better camera for our trip to Cancun. Waterproof, very nice picture quality, responsive, very good zoom for a small factor camera, lightweight and the videos are top notch!I was seeing other people with those disposable waterproof cameras and felt sorry about them. Don't do that! Buy this one and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT WATERPROOF CAMERA REALLY GREAT PHOTOS AND QUALITY!
Reviews.Author: Pedro Pauta F
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS UNDERWATER IT REALLY WORKS I GO TO WATER PARKS AND POOL PARTYS REALIZING ALL MY PAST CAMERAS HAVE WATER DAMAGE SO I DID IT RIGHT AND GOT THIS GENIUS WATER PROOF SONY HIGH QUALITY CAMERA !!!

Reviews.Title: I don't think there is a better camera in its class for the money
Reviews.Author: Jim & Laura
Reviews.Content: Its water proof - shock proof - light weight - takes great pictures and allot of great features.  I don't think there is a better camera in its class for the money

Reviews.Title: Glad I took a chance on this great little camera.
Reviews.Author: fineartsfan
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Purchased the camera at a great price and it takes fantastic pictures outside in natural light.  We went to Universal Studios, Orlando and took pictures of the Harry Potter Hogwarts Castle and other attractions.  The photos look fantastic and the small size makes it ideal for vacation use.I haven't used the camera for under water photos yet, but look forward to using that feature.

Reviews.Title: Flash function broke after one year
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for just over a year, and it worked well, while it worked; but on vacation last week, the flash broke. I'd probably try a different brand if you want a waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera - In and Out of the Water
Reviews.Author: RM
Reviews.Content: This is a fun camera. I previously had the TS100 (similar but not a touchscreen or waterproof model) and the TX10. My TX10 mysteriously stopped working after I loaned it to my brother to use in the Caribbean, and I initially bought a cheaper waterproof Panasonic camera to replace it. The Panasonic didn't take very good pictures, so I sold it and upgraded to the TX20. It's been fun to have, especially in the pool, at the lake, hiking, at sporting events when it's raining, etc., and it takes good pictures both in and out of the water.

Reviews.Title: Best buy for your buck!
Reviews.Author: Little J
Reviews.Content: I have done quite a bit of research about this camera and have found that it is one of the best cameras in it's class.  I have to say, I am weary about the water seals because i have heard about them drying up or being flimsy, but for the most part this camera definitely deserves all the praise and awards.  I have taken this camera to china for sight seeing, family outings, rafting, swimming in the pool, and even zip-lining.  It has definitely held its own and still works great.  It takes great digital pictures and it's quick and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my camara realy good and the price is better i enjoy very much the camara in my vacation in disney

Reviews.Title: Nice Water Proof Camera
Reviews.Author: MJH
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I need a water proof camera. The picture quality is not the best but it's good enough considering it's water proof and low cost enough. Everything works well, nothing wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I have dropped it many times and it is still going strong! I have taken it to many different beaches with different types of sand, pools of all sorts, high altitudes, below the gulf, almost anywhere you can think to take it. It has been awesome! The auto mode is what I use almost always, but it has so many options you can use! I bought 2 off brand batteries and a 64gb SDcard (Not micro, just straight up SD card) for it, and I would recommend you do the same! If I had to buy another camera, it would be this!! The only thing I wish they would have done is made it drop proof too. But thats what Squaretrade is for! I would not buy this without a 3 year accident warranty on it!!

Reviews.Title: amazing photos and videos, but not very rugged
Reviews.Author: Christine Kam "Poodle Lover"
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased two of these!! The first one had a door defect which allowed some salt water to get in the battery area, so I purchased another one (I contacted Sony and because it was outside of the 1 year warranty, they were not able to do anything for me). Purchased a second one because I really loved how easy it was to use and the fact that it was small and took great photos and video, but about 1 year and 2 months after, we were on our honeymoon in Puerto Rico and I was taping us in the ocean when it stopped working. I noticed that a corner of the battery area was cracked (seriously?!?!?!) so it was a goner. Luckily, I had purchased the warranty on square trade, so I contacted them (it was still within the 2 year warranty time), and they will be sending me money to replace my camera. I really loved this camera, but I don't think that it's a true rugged camera. I'm not very rough on my electronics, and this one always seems to be letting water in!!!! :(

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Claudio Morales
Reviews.Content: great, very good,complies fully what is proposed, easy to handle and transport better than I thought. I recommend buying the product and the store.

Reviews.Title: Great all purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Merrie K. Trujillo
Reviews.Content: perfect for vacationing and travel.  takes fantastic pictures and videos too!  it's so fun to not worry about rain, dirt or dropping it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera but get familiar with user interface
Reviews.Author: Sunshine Bear
Reviews.Content: Fits in a pocket which is very handy when traveling.  Takes surprisingly great shots and video.  We have an older version of this camera and love it so much we bought this one.  I love the photos and videos it takes, but navigating the user interface to adjust settings is a nightmare.  Do yourself a favor and use this camera in a variety of settings to get comfortable with navigating the user interface before you take this camera to  anything important like a vacation or sentimental occasion.  I usually do this with all new cameras, but since we owned the older version did not, and paid for it when we took this backcountry sea kayaking.

Reviews.Title: 2 star
Reviews.Author: Yvonne S. Mohr
