Reviews.Content: I love the camera but its was not the item I expecting they did not stated how deep the camera will go  I was expecting 33feet deep underwater so I can go scuba diving that far but this camera only 16 feet deep so I contact the Sony company to change into 33 feet deep camera but the charge me so much for exchanging the item pissed me off  the should change the product w/out charge because its only 1-2 days on me and I did not even use the camera  never again

Reviews.Title: Perfect for active outdoors..
Reviews.Author: ATL MCW
Reviews.Content: We use this camera camping, hiking, at the beach and most recently at a very wet and rainy music festival. Takes great still and video.  Very impressed with its low light pictures in the enhanced mode.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera but this one stopped working after a month.
Reviews.Author: SurferGrrl
Reviews.Content: I love this camera... the picture quality is amazing and there are all kinds of functions for the photographer to take control of the settings for the ideal picture. Iʻve bought one in the past and loved it but I dropped it and the door broke so I canʻt use it underwater anymore. I bought this one to replace that one so that I can use one underwater however it broke after just one month of use. Will update how the return/exchange process was handled.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: vicky swaney
Reviews.Content: We love this camera, it takes very good pictures and is very easy to use, i would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: easy and excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Steffi D.
Reviews.Content: i love this camera, it's easy in operating, touchscreen reacts fast and reliable. It takes pics very fast, and they have a good quality. It is waterproof and takes good underwater photos

Reviews.Title: my favorite cam
Reviews.Author: anita
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd SONY CYBER SHOT ... first I dropped it after my excursion in BORA BORA/ South Pacific...Then my 2nd I lost it on my cruise... Then I wanted to have this again... And I was surprised when I realized this is a bit different then the previous two were. Because its waterproof, and it has more features. Amazing pictures what I shot with it!

Reviews.Title: works well!
Reviews.Author: karatestudent
Reviews.Content: I used it on my last vacation. works well. I have to just make sure I rinse everytime I use it underwater ( ocean)

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Jeslyn
Reviews.Content: The camera is good and has many differeny functions. The pictures produced are beautiful and clear. No complaints so far.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe that Sony won't help you
Reviews.Author: K. L. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by explaining this is a two part review, one side about the camera, and the other about sony's customer support.The camera by itself I would only give 3 stars, because while it was amazing, and I loved using it, it did ultimately leak on the 4th day of our trip (right as I got into the water at stingray city, nonetheless! Heartbreaking!). I purchased this camera right before I traveled with a girlfriend to Grand Cayman, after much deliberation, research, and comparisons. The price, and amount of positive reviews won me over (I got the blue one for $179 and $5 s&h...even; the people at sony support were impressed with that deal!).Now, I am not "camera knowledgeable" by any means. I get caught up in all the capabilities cameras have over one another when I'm researching (nitpicking shutter speeds, and ISOs, and heaven forbid one camera have any percentage of megapixels over the other, haha) when honestly all I needed was a camera that took decent underwater pictures for snorkeling, and this one fulfilled that purpose perfectly. Even the friend I went with (who had the Panasonic Lumix TS3) was very impressed with some of the photos this little camera took. Only complaint functionality-wise I might've had was the battery tended to die long before I was ready to quit snorkeling. But then again, I wanted to snorkel all day long.Yes, as other reviewers stated, you can't mess with settings while underwater (and it's near impossible to tread water and change settings...believe me, I tried), but in reality it's easy enough to set things up prior to a water excursion, just don't forget to do it. Yes, first world problems to the extreme, I know.I followed others' instructions to a T after every snorkeling adventure: a 10 minute soak in fresh water, followed by a rinse. And everything was perfect...until that 4th day. Sadly, the whole reason Grand Cayman was chosen as our trip of choice was also the downfall of my beautiful little camera. Thankfully, we had the Panasonic for pictures, but that was it for Sony Cyber-shot TX20.Which leads me into the Sony Support...Because I'd bought my camera so close to the trip, it was gratefully still under it's 30-day warranty, and the Sony Support team was awesome. The first lady I talked to recommended purchasing an extended damage warranty (which I did, and was grateful for in the long run, as having that warranty number made things much easier). I will not say the whole process wasn't time consuming and a bit extended (there was a week where I got busy, and didn't return Sony's calls, and the broken camera got sent back to me, but Sony Support emailed me a free Fedex shipping label to send it back, even though it was my negligence!), but all the people I dealt with were awesome and very helpful. I understood the Sony universe did not revolve around me, and was happy to give the information they needed as many times as they needed it, and in return they were happy to help me.My TX20 was damaged beyond repair, and because the TX20 was an outdated model, I received in the mail today, my brand new Sony Cybershot TX30. And still in the beautiful blue color, since I kindly asked the guy if I could get my replacement in the same blue I loved, which he assured me was no problem. It was a lot of phone time, but I really cannot speak enough praise of the Sony team for coming through for me. Five stars to them.In closing, yes, my camera leaked, but I got the newer, pricier version for the cost of a warranty. It really was a cute, functional camera, and our trip was full of strange mishaps (including getting "stranded" on the island for 3 extra days), so the drowned camera wasn't the end of the world. I just highly recommend when purchasing this camera, get the extended warranty, just in case.Now, all I need is another GC trip to write my TX30 review!

Reviews.Title: Tough little camera.
Reviews.Author: F. Szeto "Viewfinder"
Reviews.Content: I did a 5 feet drop test to concrete pavement and it survived. It has a small scratch from it. Of course it wasn't really a test, it was an accident. The camera for a few moment can't focus and as I turn it off and and reboot it, Everything was fine. I didn't have a chance to go underwater yet. I bought a waterproof pouch for extra protection but didn't get to use it.The camera's photos looks great most of the time. I also liked the panoramic feature that you can do both vertical and horizontal. Couple of not so great qualities are short battery life, about 200 shots (more if you don't check out your photos), be sure you have at least a couple of spare batteries. Buy the batteries with a charger. I didn't and have to charge the battery through the camera and it gets annoying. Another complaint is the lack of control, you basically give up your exposure control to the camera and hoped that the camera do it right, and it does most of the time. But nothing is perfect and it does ruin some shots for me. But for a travel camera, it is easily pocket-able and it takes a regular SD card and being tough and waterproof you got a great travel companion.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Keith I. Pierson
Reviews.Content: This camera seems pretty cool.  I am a camera guy, and also a whitewater river guy.  I snorkel down rivers sometimes and found this in a whitewater river after a class 3 rapid.  The camera had been there for over 2 months on the bottom of a river and I took it home and set it on a shelf to dry in my basement.A month later I found it cleaning up, opened it up and the damn thing turned on and works fine.  I cleaned it up and it's working great now, although the finish shows that it spent two months in a river, but golly it still works!

Reviews.Title: Fast Shutter!
Reviews.Author: J. Tapp "pictureladyj"
Reviews.Content: I love that I don't have to wait long after pushing the button for picture to actually snap!  I am a professional portrait photographer who does not like lugging a Canon Markiii around for shots of the kids at parties and events.

Reviews.Title: It is great water camera with great price!
Reviews.Author: YUAN YUAN
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use and easy to play and save pics and video in the computer.  it also takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Junior
Reviews.Content: Very handy camera that is easy to use. The features "______ proof" are great and work as expected. I really enjoyed being able to take the camera into the ocean to take pictures from a different p.o.v

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Underwater Shots
Reviews.Author: Criminal
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace another "waterproof" camera that blew a gasket. It was fantastic on our trip to Maui. Very easy to use with crisp video and pictures. It was easy enough for my 10 year old son to use on his own while snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: Second time buying same camera
Reviews.Author: Caroleen
Reviews.Content: This is the second identical camera I've purchased.  The first suffered a short temporary death after a fall from my pocket (only three feet).  Fortunately, I purchased the warranty and Sony made it good with a two week turnaround (fair time frame for me).  However, I loved this camera so much and was impatient for a replacement so I bought a second to use in the interim.Focus Camera was quick in order processing in shipment.  I ordered the pink one this time and the last one was blue.  I love them both.  I am disappointed that it didn't live up to it's 5 foot shock proof claim but I think it was also because it fell right on the corner where the battery cover was.  That caused the camera to throw an error and stop focusing correctly.This little gem is tough besides that and I enjoyed the camera enough that I bought an identical model.  At least now I have a back up!

Reviews.Title: NIce
Reviews.Author: John M. Snider
Reviews.Content: Very nice item. Small & durable. Lots of extra features for a small gadget. Recommend this item to anyone. Fun...

Reviews.Title: Died of water intrusion after 4 months
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera, but like other reviewers, it died of water intrusion despite making sure the seals were maintained.  I dropped it once and the side of the camera opened up, and even though it closed fine and I was able to use it underwater after that, I suspect that the leak occurred through the shell rather than the seals.Also like other reviewers I had significant issues with the camera lens cover opening in my pocket.  This happened more frequently than not so I stopped carrying it in a pocket.  And similarly to others, any use of it on the beach will result in sand getting trapped behind the door and scratching the surface.The smile detection is a cool feature and worked on the few times I tried it.  The panorama works well.  The photo and video quality is good.One very annoying thing I don't see mentioned elsewhere is that Sony uses a very unusual file structure and puts the photos and videos in separate locations, and even puts different formats of videos in different locations.  The result is you're never sure if you've downloaded all your photos & videos.  I find this highly unusual compared to other brands - Canon, Nikon, Fuji, Olympus.When it was working I would have given it 4 stars, but having your camera die after a few months is no good.  I have owned an Olympus waterproof camera for many years without a problem.  The design of the camera which allows it to split open around the edges is a bad design.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Carolynn Burwick
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively inexpensive waterproof camera.  It takes pretty good pictures out of the water, which was most important, but it is a neat little perk to also be able to get it wet without worrying about it breaking.  My only complaint is that it doesn't have a viewfinder other than the screen which is impossible to see in bright sun (beach) conditions.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew Yasiejko
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, both in and out of water. It has a good number of shooting modes and takes good panoramas and low-light pictures. It's also nice to be able to take pictures while you're shooting video.

Reviews.Title: Not for water use
Reviews.Author: T. Pace
Reviews.Content: Device worked great until I used it to go diving.  Followed all instructions however device stopped working after first use under water.

Reviews.Title: WATERPROOF CAMERA AT THE PRICE OF A POINT AND SHOOT
Reviews.Author: James Clark
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera to take with me on an Alaskan fishing trip where the weather was rainy 5 days out of 8. It worked perfectly even with rain  running down the viewfinder. Do a lot of fishing and this camera is perfect for my life style

Reviews.Title: Fast enough to catch a Busy Toddler on pocket Digital
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Laker Babe"
Reviews.Content: So far I LOVE this camera. We took to Knotts Berry Farm for Birthday picks of my 9yr old. Great colorful shots. I also took this out to the BMX track & was able to get great action shots of the 9yrs old as well as my busy & always moving 3 yr old sons. I haven't taken to the beach with sand or in the water yet. But we have a pool party on Saturday & I am sure it will do just fine.Very easy yo use. I would easily suggest this camera to friends & family,As always buying from Amazon easy & on time, I enjoy my Prime benefits. Thank you Amazon - I am a very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Chen Chen
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera. But terrible customer service. I bought this camera for 5 month. The handle piece came off by it self. Send back, they will not fix it. Because by their opinion it is physical damage. I told them it is production issue, but they do not listen. Anyway, will not buy any Sony product from this point on.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: It's priced right, waterproof, and takes awesome pics and videos.  We have owned another waterproof camera, and the quality doesn't even come close to this one.  This is the perfect camera if you want nice looking pictures or HD video but will be in/around water or doing outdoorsy things that might knock the camera around.  Durable, small, and even looks nice.  Fits right in my husband's pocket.  He originally didn't want a new camera b/c he says the iPhone takes pictures just fine, but after this purchase we take this with us just about everywhere now...and I see him use it more than the iPhone!  Score!

Reviews.Title: Awsome :)
Reviews.Author: Hana
Reviews.Content: I've used the close up a lot and gotten great pictures of flowers and bugs. I have yet to try the underwater feature yet but am looking forward to it. The pictures are good quality and the camera is easy to use. :D

Reviews.Title: poor charging design
Reviews.Author: Auntie Kat
Reviews.Content: I had the tx5 and LOVED it! Was hoping this one would be as good. The camera itself is pretty much the same. What I think is a step down in design is the way the tx20 charges. You can't pop the battery out and plug it in directly to the outlet charger, which was a small charger that plugged directly into the wall receptacle. SO nice! That was great on the tx5 model, because you could pop out the battery and pop in your second charged battery and continue shooting. Now, with the tx20, the camera is out of commission while the inconvenient short, barely flexible cord has to attach directly to the camera and then the cord and plug to the outlet. On top of that, the fragile door to the waterproof charging port compartment now stays open during charging, gets bumped, the camera rests on the open door because the cord is not very flexible, etc. etc. So, I don't have faith that it will remain waterproof for long. It seems to me it will misalign. My tx5 was waterproof for about 6 years or so. I wish I had been more careful with it.

Reviews.Title: Good pics, quick, sleek, versatile!
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Much sleeker and slim than my bulkier Panasonic Lumix (although I loved that one too, lost it on vacation, that one seemed a little more solid/rugged) so even though it's waterproof and great for hikes and waterfall rappelling and underwater adventures, I still like taking it to clubs or weddings because it looks sleek rather than bulky like a lot of waterproof options. I get compliments on the picture quality. It's quick to start up / take pics / recover and be ready to take again. The slide down front protects the lens and makes it easy to turn on by flipping down and I haven't noticed any issues with dirt getting in it (rinse after it's in the elements) or it coming loose or anything. I like the options. Touch screen is pretty responsive but sometimes accidentally gets touched and moves screens and doesn't respond when scrolling through pictures. Fingers can get in the way of the lens because of how close to the top/edge it is. Only real complaint is I can't just download and use videos. You have to download their software and publish to sites from there, it's not a normal format you can send or use other than in their program. But the camera is a fantastic little guy. I've used it on the beach, in up and around waterfalls and on hikes and in daily use just out and about.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, just like the previous versions
Reviews.Author: Sethmatics Inc. "Seth Carstens"
Reviews.Content: We have had just about every version of this camera now. Do note, if you give the camera to kids, and they open the battery area under water... you will have to buy a new camera like we just did... DOH.

Reviews.Title: Slim and sleek but a little flimsy
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Pros: No over done rugged exterior, slips in and out of pockets with ease. Slender and light weight. Very nice picture quality. Video quality is pretty good as well but not quite as good as a go-pro.Cons:USB cable is specific to this camera, what a stupid thing to do Sony. Universal USB compatibility is a must these days. The gaskets are not heavy duty enough and all the exposed seams and cracks make it easy for little bits of sand to get in them. I thankfully only had one incident where it appeared a tiny bit of moisture got in, but I think for the most part, if you're relatively gentle with it, and make very, very sure that the gaskets are tightly sealed and there's absolutely no debris in the way before you close them, it should be 100% waterproof. Photos get washed out when using the zoom feature. No manual mode but it's a point and shoot, whattya expecting here. Annoying software pops up when you connect to your computer. Without using this software I had trouble just cutting and pasting the photos while accessing them through windows explorer. I did not appear to delete them from the camera through windows explorer.On the whole, a slim, sleek, waterproof camera, that still leaves a bit to be desired in terms of overall ruggedness.

Reviews.Title: Don't like this camera
Reviews.Author: Margie Florida "Margie"
Reviews.Content: Worst thing is when you upload pics to computer it changes the format for all your pics. Also, you can't upload videos to Facebook, I don't usually give bad reviews without allowing time to get used to the product but it has been long enough. I guess its good for divers so they can use it under water, I wouldn't know have not done that get.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera !!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: rideabiketoday
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this camera !! I got it strictly to use for fishing. It has served that purpose well. It takes crisp HD video and wonderful quality pictures. The waterproof aspect is priceless. It has been bombproof so far. My favorite feature is that it turns on quickly by simply sliding down the front cover; boom, it's ready to go. This is important when dealing with nature, as it is unpredictable. Huge fan of this camera. In addition; the HD video quality is second to none. I have posted a bunch of videos, I took with this camera, to Facebook, and people are shocked they are from my "point and shoot", and not my higher end Nikon.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is Awesome
Reviews.Author: Erin Lawton
Reviews.Content: I have taken this camera everywhere with me since I got it.  I love that you can take stills while recording video.  I also LOVE the soft skin feature and use it when I am out with the girls.  Only complaint is it is already chipped, which I'm hoping does not effect the waterproofing.  It is near the gasket, but from what I can tell is only cosmetic.

Reviews.Title: Great Videos
Reviews.Author: Des Hope "Des Hope"
Reviews.Content: This is a great underwater camera.  I recently took it to Tahiti and was amazed at the pictures and video when I got home and downloaded them on my computer.  Buy an extra battery because you don't want to run out in the middle of something important (I do that with all my cameras).  I have loaned this camera to a friend and they took amazing underwater pictures of the kids in the pool last weekend.  Price is very reasonable and it's an excellent quality.  (Unfortunately mine was missing the wrist strap in the box from Amazon.)

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!!!  That's all caps!
Reviews.Author: jamijah
Reviews.Content: I am a mother of an 8 year old son who has shown an interest in photography and asked for a camera for his birthday.  As we spend a lot of time in or near water I wanted to get a waterproof camera and because he is 8 I wanted shock proof as well.  I did some research and looked at reviews and this camera came up in the top three.  As we are already sony camera owners (this is our 4th) I decided to bite the bullet despite the cost (he's 8 but who knows maybe the next great photographer) and buy this camera for his birthday.  This camera is absolutely amazing!  Very user friendly (we are no camera experts), touch screen, tons of options and modes and WATERPROOF!!!!  From the ability to take black and whites and painting style shots, to great underwater shots and video with the ability to zoom inside the video this was an exceptional purchase and well worth the cost.  Did I mention there is an option to add music (for videos) and create HD pictures and videos?  The list goes on and on but if you are thinking about purchasing a nice point and shot, waterproof, shock proof camera look no further...this is it!

Reviews.Title: excelent products
Reviews.Author: guillermo78
Reviews.Content: All the items for the camera were what I expected in quality . The price was the more convenient in the market.

Reviews.Title: No problems
Reviews.Author: jellybean
Reviews.Content: After researching different waterproof cameras, I choose the Cyber-Shot.  And I am so glad I did.  My husband and I went to Mexico and had no troubles at all.  The underwater pictures were beautiful and the colors were sharp. Of course taking pictures of the sandy bottom of the ocean were not very colorful.  A school of fish swam right by us and it took wonderful pictures. The video was also terrific.  My husband was able to operate the video underwater easily and again beautiful pictures.  The other great thing about the camera is that it is small it can fit in a pocket.  We used this camera over our other more bulky Cannon when we were on some excursions. The battery life also was not bad.  It lasted us the whole day and then some.  We just kept the viewfinder closed (again something that we very easy to operate when underwater or on land) when not in use.  It was so easy to take care of too.  After using it in the water,  we just put it in a bowl of plain water (we used the sink at the hotel) and let it sit for a few minutes just like the instructions said. Wonderful camera. So happy we purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Epaka
Reviews.Content: When you factor in all the characteristics of this camera: size, ease of use, image quality, durability, and the greatly reduced price as it is the 2012 model (I bought it new in 2013, for less than 200) it is clearly a real winner. In fact, in some ways it is a better design than the latest Cybershot TX model. The images produced will not stand up to a DSLR, but will give you a picture that is far superior to your smartphone. You have limited manual control, but you can always adjust the basics (flash on or off, exposure compensation, white balance), and if you experiment a little with all of the preset scene controls such as 'handheld twilight', 'fast motion', etc. you can get great results. Those scene controls may at first seem like silly gimmicks for someone (such as myself) who also shoots with a DSLR and high quality prime lenses, but with a camera like this you need to embrace the gimmicks to get good results. I've been very impressed by the cameras abilities in low light situations. It also shoots amazingly good video for such a small device.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: April "Yardy215"
Reviews.Content: I've used Sony very years and I've always been satisfied with their overall product.  And to hear that they came out with a waterproof camera was music to my ears.  The item described arrived in a timely manner and as published on the site.  I'm very satisfied with my product.  I'm still playing with the features and I shall fully test the product out next week in the water.

Reviews.Title: Review of Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-TX20
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: I really have no complaints with this camera. It delivers what it promises and more. I enjoy the freedom to capture on the fly exciting moments while hiking and exploring. Its learning curve has not been a challenge.

Reviews.Title: First one died in 2 days, second one seems ok
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moJB5HPSVY20FW', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moJB5HPSVY20FWloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_moJB5HPSVY20FWpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_moJB5HPSVY20FWpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/711AfxRPMwS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moJB5HPSVY20FWcurrentClick) { return cv_moJB5HPSVY20FWcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:57 MinsI ordered a Warehouse Deal (used) DSC-TX20 from Amazon prime and it was delivered o Friday. I used the camera Saturday afternoon in both a lake and a pool for about 4 hours. I again used the camera on Sunday of the same weekend in the lake. When I got home from the lake the lens was foggy. I opened up the battery compartment (which WAS locked securely) and sure enough there were droplets of water on the battery and memory card. Rather than take a chance and risking it again with a used camera I sent the Camera back to amazon and bought a NEW one from a third party seller (Tri State Camera). The next camera arrived on Wednesday. The camera was the SPANISH version with spanish stickers and a 240V power cord with the round prongs. I saved $15 bucks off the MSRP so I'll live with it... anyway, back to the camera... The DSC-TX20 performed well today on the lake as expected on the first day and I will report back my findings in a few weeks. I have uploaded a video of the unit in action under water. The movie quality is pretty good, as is the picture quality. Be sure to set the camera to MP4 instead of Sony's weird AVC file format otherwise your computer will choke on the video and the interlacing will be horrible (even with VideoLAN blending). The zoom is very good for only being 4x and the digital zoom looks pretty good too. The battery lasts long enough for a boat outing. If the camera holds up this time I would say it a worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: marcus
Reviews.Content: great pics under water and out of water i love this camera and when it has a fabric case on i don't have to worry about throwing it in the water or jumping in with it really cool and very awesome first five minutes of using it i put in a bowl of water to test it out great battery too which seems like a big problem when looking to buy a waterproof camera

Reviews.Title: I'm
Reviews.Author: Jarek Luczak
Reviews.Content: Recommend this Seller wszysto as described and fast shipping. Goods of good quality I intend to buy at the store. The only thing missing suitcase full satisfaction so I decided to give four stars.

Reviews.Title: Nifty Waterproof Camera - Good for all ocassions
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I initially went into the underwater camera market to take photos for a few trips I was taking to go snorkeling and kayaking and ended so impressed with this model that that I ended up selling the point and shoot I had at the time. It has held up exceptionally well ever since! The design of it also fares very well for out of the water, social occasions. It doesn't look bulky or toy-ish like a lot of other underwater/durable cameras tend to look like.It's tough enough to swing on my pfd while I kayak and on my wrist while I snorkel and occasionally get distracted by fish or a wave takes me and end up smashing into a rock!There are also some neat effects and filters on the camera that are really fun to play with; I find myself using the panorama quite often as well as the tilt-shift.The battery does run out fairly quickly, my only real complaint. It will last a day at least if you're not going to crazy with it.Otherwise a great and practical camera to have on hand for any occasion - wet or dry!

Reviews.Title: You want a cheap good camera? This is it
Reviews.Author: Diego Rojas
Reviews.Content: I like my TX20.. is cheap and photos are very good considering the price... haven't tried the waterproof yet.I recommend it

Reviews.Title: Camera's a lemon and customer service is terrible
Reviews.Author: Sara Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera has had multiple issues and I have only had it for 1 year.  The issues started when I had the camera for only about 8 months.  I am about to send it back in to be fixed for the 3rd time!  The first time, Sony didn't even attempt to fix one of the issues I had requested.  When I sent it in to be fixed it took about a month to get it back and it  still wasn't even returned until I contacted them inquiring about it!  Sony customer service has not listened to or addressed many issues I have brought up.  They refuse to give me a refund... they just want me to continue to send the camera in for repair!  Until today they hadn't even acknowledged the fact that I have asked for a refund about 4 times now.  They just don't listen!  They refuse to compromise or realize how ridiculous this continues to be.  The time Sony and I have spent on this camera and it's issues has FAR outweighed the cost of the camera and offering a refund... and the ordeal is still continuing.  The last time I contacted them they sent me the same exact response twice, but about a month apart!  Their behavior and responses while dealing with my camera's issues have proven to me that they lack respect and care for their customers.

Reviews.Title: Died the first time I put it under water
Reviews.Author: Melanie Ligon Sandridge
Reviews.Content: I am sure that my camera was probably defective.  I bought it several months before a trip to Grand Cayman.  It worked fine "above water".  Two days after arriving in Grand Cayman, we went on a four stop snorkeling trip.  After going under water one time, it no longer worked.  I had no camera for the remainder of the trip.  I appreciate the fact that Amazon took it back since it was past the return date.  Although, I was charged 30.00 for a restocking fee...somewhat of a bummer since it was defective.  I am sure it is a great camera...but, something was obviously wrong with me and I had no camera for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: Nice, cute
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Works great. Used it quite a bit so far. Taking pics in the house. I like the little feature where even if it's dark like in a room, it makes the pic look like it was taken in bright light. Helps alot with me keeping my house pretty dark in the evenings. I hate too much bright light. Bothers me alot and this camera is perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: JustCoz
Reviews.Content: "The best camera is the one you have with you."  I have no idea who said that, but it's true.  Many years ago I bought my wife aSony T77 because she wanted a small point & shoot.  It's a great camera!  Outstanding optics (Carl Zeiss), solid  build quality, superior imaging even in low light, and Sony programming running the show. What's not to like?So when my sister finally realized her cell phone actually wasn't a camera she asked me for help. ( I personally shoot with a SonyNEX 5n and love it [much smaller than most camera's in it's class].....see a pattern developing here? )  So after doing the research, the TX20 was a no brainer.  All the same attributes my wife loves in her camera and more.  More pixels, updated software (programming & controls almost exactly the same as my NEX 5n), same Carl Zeiss optics.  All in a rugged case small enough to have with you at all times.Like I said.....No Brainer!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent price for a sony camera
Reviews.Author: Mar
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera, sony is always awesome and reliable.  It's water proof, dust proof.  It detects smiles, very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Its very good for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: angie
Reviews.Content: i like everything about the features and everything i just dont like that the screen is a little slow its touch screen but kinda seems like it gets stuck or you need to press harder for it to move. other than that takes great pictures. good underwater pictures. good features. i would recommend it if they are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof!!
Reviews.Author: Matt Jones
Reviews.Content: It says it's "Certified waterproof". Well, let me be the 1st to tell you that it is NOT water proof.The 1st time I took it into the water while on vacation it instantly shut off!We let it dry out before trying to power it up and it still didn't work.

Reviews.Title: RECOMMENDED
Reviews.Author: Michela F.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT!!!! IT'S TOO BEAUTIFUL!!! ...THE PICTURES IT TAKES ARE SPECTACULAR...REALLY, FROM WHAT LITTLE I COULD TRY IT!!IT'S GREAT!!I HAVE NOTHING BAD TO SAY ABOUT IT!!!RECOMMENDED 100%

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Pipebras
Reviews.Content: The quality of the image it's perfect! I tested on the pool and takes great images. Video also on HD quality.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool camera!
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I took this to some Springs while kayaking and let me just say this little guy is awesome. I love the slick and sleekness of it. It took clear pictures underwater. The panorama part of this camera is an excellent features and has many settings to chose from. I was glad to see it was touch screen as well.

Reviews.Title: I love the camera...
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Bravo Jr. "soccer engineer"
Reviews.Content: I just finished buying this camera at the Sony store in San Marcos, TX.  I am really happy with the camera that i felt compelled to come on here and write a review.Positives:* its waterproof and shock proof.  I already dropped it once or twice and nothing happened to it.* it has the time stamp option for pictures which is something i like since i have kids growing up really fast before our eyes.  And the time stamp is something i like for keeping track of what age my kids were when the picture was taken.* the snap down shutter is awesome.  You can quickly turn it on and off to get going.* i owned another cybershot and this tx20 is much faster at taking pictures and processing them quickly so you can get ready to take another shot.  I love this about the camera.  It achieves this best in outdoors and in auto green setting.* it records movies in HDNegatives:* the package can be deceiving as the box itself doesnt say the camera is waterproof anywhere on it until you actually open the package.* the camera is very sensitive when doing movies...it picks up all sounds including the breeze blowing by which can be annoying sometimes.* doesnt come with a wall plug charger for battery itself.  You have to buy it separate.  The only way to charge the camera out of the package is plugging it into a USB which is usually a computer.  Or a USB plug for the wall.I have yet to dip it in water but i am sure it will be fine. I have carried it in the rain and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: California Mom
Reviews.Content: I used this for our vacation to French Polynesia.  It takes great pictures under water.  I used it in the ocean so there were a couple pictures that showed a splash of salt water on the lens.  I noticed it when reviewing the pictures later that day so the following day I ensured that the lens was clear before taking pictures.  The remainder of the photos were fine.  It is nice and small and people were surprised it was for under water.  The on-land pictures look great too.  I have a Canon 5D Mark II DSLR and sometimes I would use this tiny camera for scenic pics as I didn't want to scramble to take my big camera out.  The HD video is sharp as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Waterproof Cybershot!
Reviews.Author: Allen The Actor
Reviews.Content: I got 3 (three) TX20s last year at an amazing dirt cheap price from Amazon as one of their lightning deals. Anyway, it's a great camera! The new TX30 is better, but only slightly. This camera is a very fun and great quality product if you snatch it up at the right price. It doesn't feel cheap, has a great looking high res screen (which is too sensitive and you can't properly use in the water, but it's not bad), but it's a great looking large screen.Zoom is great, and I love that you can zoom QUIETLY while filming in the EXCELLENT quality AVCHD video, which looks better than some of Sony's cheaper camcorders. Amazing to have AVCHD in a small package like this, and with stereo audio, etc.Picture quality is great in bright or decent light. Not the sharpest pics but sharp enough for casual shooting! Lots of different modes you can play with, from picture effects, to different modes that help make a better looking pic (scene selection, HDR, High res panorama, etc). Low light pics are slightly grainy in dark corners of the pic but it has a good flash and they still look good!Waterproof capability is so worth it and fun! Works great and you can take it anywhere!Overall, great cybershot cam from Sony!

Reviews.Title: good price but terrible touch screen
Reviews.Author: Shihwen Huang
Reviews.Content: the price is good on this sony water proof camera.Pro:small compact, nice design, relatively good picture quality on the water proof cameraCon:terrible touch screen, slow response

Reviews.Title: Don't have took high hopes!
Reviews.Author: cdon
Reviews.Content: I  bought  this  camera  for our  family cruise and imagine  my disappointment  when on  our snorkeling excursion, the camera kaputted.  It left me with no more camera for the  duration of the cruise!  I've had the camera 7 months,  and it takes nice pictures  but I'm now missing out in my scrapbook of tons of pictures that I should have had!  Very frustrated  customer!! I expected more out of this camera after all the outside reviews.  Lots of wasted money on this camera,  but to mention the heartache!

Reviews.Title: Took some wonderful pictures with it
Reviews.Author: J.S.
Reviews.Content: The reason I bought this camera is because it is waterproof. My wife and I had so much fun during the vacation at the beach, taking pictures underwater and while surfing. I'd say this camera is a MUST if you're going to take pictures at the beach/swimming pool.The only downside I can think of: The camera kept getting vapors/steam near the lens. I'm guessing it's because of the temperature difference between the air and water (water was cold, but it was about 85 outside).

Reviews.Title: Sony TX20
Reviews.Author: Jamie Vander Meer
Reviews.Content: Photo quality pretty good.Video quality below average.Great water, dust and shock resistance.Really low price.Great for camping trips and the pool and kayaking.Overall, nice little pocket camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Felker
Reviews.Content: I have owned many different Sony Cyber-shot cameras and for YEARS!! This one is by far my favorite. I love how it is tougher than the previous ones, meaning it can handle water, dirt, sand, beach, tub, pool, rain - all the places I love to take pictures of my busy boys. I purchased the silicone slip cover/holder that goes with this and that is great too (but I'll save that for a different review).Things I like over the previous model:Slimmer and more lightweightsliding cover to protect lens is better (old one would get sand/dirt in it and freeze up/get jammed)Able to take pictures while taking a video (capture a scene)Able to zoom while taking a videoFaster capture for pictures (on easy mode -not sure about the other modes)Fits in my hand easily -I just have to remember to keep my fingers out of the view finderThings I like better on the previous/older models:view finder/lens position. I feel like I never had to worry about my fingers getting into the shot before and now I do

Reviews.Title: Good so far
Reviews.Author: K. Schrock "auntie"
Reviews.Content: I haven't tried the underwater function yet but above water it is pretty easy to use and picture quality is decent. I am still learning all the functions and the settings. I haven't printed any pictures yet so I don't know the picture quality in that aspect.  Low light settings don't seem too great but not many cameras in this league do well in low lighting so I'm not too surprised. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: abraham ramos
Reviews.Content: Very good photos, clear, good lightning, quality, easy to use and got it in a deal of the day very cheap, this i would say is the best purchase i have made in amazon

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera and fast shipping
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! I bought it a year after buying another camera that I never liked. My first camera was a Sony and I should have stuck with this brand. This camera takes amazing pictures and is small and not heavy! Love the color and it's easy to use!!!! Battery charges fast and holds a good charge!!!

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Hermann
Reviews.Content: I've had a lot of waterproof cameras, almost 5 of them. Sony cybershoots are great, and waterproof is perfect. I hate my old Olympus I had a couple of them, too slow and average picture quality.

Reviews.Title: not the same color
Reviews.Author: BORA BILGIN
Reviews.Content: I paid 40 USD more for the pale yellow color I saw on Amazon.Then I recived a totally different bright  orange camera.For the camera, video is nice, photo is poor

Reviews.Title: Superior picture quality if you can keep your finger off the lens and don't mind cropping pictures after the fact
Reviews.Author: sam b storey
Reviews.Content: The image quality is better than any digital camera I've come across. I do have a couple of critiques though. Firstly, the lens is right up on top just where you would naturally hold it to shoot a picture. This leads to many pictures with a slice of finger across the top. Anytime you ask someone to take your picture you have to tell them to avoid this and it still happens. Also, on a recent trip to Europe I realized later that what you see in the digital display as you're shooting is a significantly larger frame than the actual photo it takes. I took 660 pictures on that trip, 2/3 of them came out with cropped faces, rooftops, landscapes, what have you. All in all a good camera for the price but shoot wide and crop later.

Reviews.Title: Leaked
Reviews.Author: Judith H. Chong
Reviews.Content: We tested this camera in swimming pools a few times & it was fine.  Second time in the ocean while snorkeling, it stopped working, even though we had followed the instructions about rinsing & checking the seals.  Pictures & video were fine, but it was easy to accidentally trigger the multiple shot function.  Battery does run down quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: Great camera takes amazing pictures put in in the pool on vacation had no issues I def recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Love my Cybershot
Reviews.Author: tjamustang
Reviews.Content: Compact size along with the quality of the pictures and video is outstanding.  My last Sony 6.2  Cybershot lasted 7 years before moving to a new camera.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: If only you can self focus macros
Reviews.Author: Panda
Reviews.Content: So this is the best PS camera I've purchased so far... shutter speed VN! on and off very easy - just slide the front panel.  Pictures and videos are clear in and out of water.Some of the limited features include:Background defocus only - you cannot focus on a specific item like your typical Macro settings... it only gives option to background defocusColor Pop shots - you cannot point at a color and have the selected color burst.  You can only choose from the default colors available in the camera (primary colors) - hated this fact, but I have a secondary PS cam I can use instead.

Reviews.Title: love the price
Reviews.Author: emiel t barrett
Reviews.Content: This camera is an amazing little addition to the digital world. I love the touch screen, the on screen options, the ease of transferring pictures. It's simply a good camera,

Reviews.Title: Awesome underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: It is very good quality. Very clear images. I'm very happy with it even for my regular camera. It's so nice that its water, sand and shock proof. Takes the worrying out of it. Would def recommend for anyone

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and video but NOT waterproof
Reviews.Author: Stan H.
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera in February and haven't had a chance to test it in the water until it has been warmer. I recorded my sons sliding on a 5 foot inflatable water slide into a 5-6" wading pool at the end. It worked great for this and didn't seem to have any problems in the water. The video looks fantastic and I was really pleased.Next weekend I took them swimming at their grandparents. The pictures looked great and I was able to take some really cool "flying" shots of them jumping in. We were in a normal sized pool for about 1 hour. I took the camera out and let it sit for a bit to dry off. When I opened the battery compartment a while later there was moisture inside. The camera still functioned and I was able to let it air dry. I was concerned and hoped it was a fluke.One week later we went swimming again. Same amount of time in the pool and same results. When I opened the battery door there was some very obvious water inside. It has dried out now and the camera still works for now but I don't expect it to be a long term investment.We are going to vacation in a week and will be visiting the hotel pool and theme water park in Florida. I hope the camera survives the trip but I won't be shocked if it doesn't. I'm expecting a few hours at a water park will probably kill it.I am severely disappointed because we've owned several Sony cameras over the years. We have 2 older ones that still work and my wife has 2 different Alpha DSLR models that she loves and takes some amazing photos with. The quality of the images you'll get with the camera are great so it really sucks that they couldn't totally pull off waterproofing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: T. Hannigan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small point and shoot camera to take with me on hikes and then to use for quick shots. I have a DSLR that I prefer to shoot with, but is sometimes too bulky, or it's too risky to use in the area. My main test so far was to take it with me to FL to run a half-marathon. I kept it in my hand the whole time and it took great shots all the way from pre-dawn to the finish of the race.The camera is tiny witch took some getting used to. I also need to find a way to change the setting of the photo review after each shot. It significantly delays your ability to take another quick shot when you're waiting for the preview to go away.

Reviews.Title: great color, great pics
Reviews.Author: C. Weber
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! It takes multiple pictures quickly and the colors are awesome! The whole camera moves quickly.  Great for active lifestyles.Love it.  Havent tried underwater yet.

Reviews.Title: very versatile camera
Reviews.Author: JAY W.
Reviews.Content: Thhis camera takes great pictues in and out of the water.  The camera is so small it easily fits in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Crystal Clear and AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Randi Cramberg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our beach/waterpark vacation in Florida! Have yet to test the underwater feature yet but the out of water picture quality is great. One of the best digital cameras I've ever owned!!!!

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: yujin jung
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX20 16.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 4x...very good very good very good very good very good very good very good very good very good very good

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Glenda Wolin
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a compact waterproof camera for an upcoming trip, and after reading reviews of several at various websites, I settled on this one. I don't know yet how it handles in rain or under water, but I have been very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the stills and videos it produces. I didn't expect much from a camera small enough to stick in a pocket, but photos have come out sharp and bright under a variety of conditions. I usually use a Nikon DSLR, and I didn't expect equal quality, but I couldn't ask for more given the limitations of a 4X zoom. I have a feeling I'll be using this a lot more than I expected to.

Reviews.Title: beautful pictures
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Bolson
Reviews.Content: For a small portable camera the pictures are amazing.  The effects and different shooting modes leave me to playing with my camera just to see what else it can handle.  It is a little on the small side, so someone with small hands would really enjoy the ease of use.  The superior automatic mode really takes most of the guess work out of most scenes giving extremely sharp pictures, some of the effects really make memorable pictures.  I really like the one solid color in a black and white seen.  I would recommend this camera to children 10 years and up and people with small hands.  Its smaller than the early touch screen type smart phones and about the same size as a flip phone folded.

Reviews.Title: Review of camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: I like the camera.... once I learn how to work the menu properly... a bit complicated for an "oldster".  About the only thing that I defiitely do not like about it is that in bright light I cannot see anything in the viewer.  I basically point and shoot and hope I get it...  I can always easily hit delete!  Also, as someone else said, you have to be very diligent about keeping your finger(s) out of the camera eye.  It's easy to take a shot with a finger -- or the strap -- in it!

Reviews.Title: Great vacation camera
Reviews.Author: r.g. delantar
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  I have a DSLR but for vacations this is my go to camera.  It's small and easy to carry, takes great pics in and out of water, easy to use.  Happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Earl Cordovez
Reviews.Content: I thanked the shockproof feature of this thing. I dropped this one time and I was sure that it was done, but when i checked it, it was just a light scratch!! As if the drop never even happened! The picture quality is amazing too! highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: So far so good...only time will tell
Reviews.Author: jim adams
Reviews.Content: This is the second waterproof camera that I have purchased.  The first was a Fuji camera that failed on it's second year of use (only two outings).  I wanted a waterproof camera that was relatively easy to use and had a decent level of quality in the photos.  So far, during initial testing, the camera seems to function quite well.  There are a ton of options (maybe too many for some) and the camera itself is not as intuitive as I had hoped.  There is no clear explanation of some of the functions and there really is no manual to speak of.  There are a few general instructions and that's about it.  The only issue I've had so far that I really don't like is that the flash is far too bright.  There doesn't seem to be a way to turn it down.  People have mentioned that the flash is quite blinding and the photos do appear a bit washed out.  I'm still practicing getting the pictures to work.  I will be using this camera in the ocean in a few weeks and will post an update on how the pictures turn out and how the camera holds up.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful in bright light
Reviews.Author: MK Reagan "Mary Kay"
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera both in and out of the water on a Caribbean snorkeling excursion with great results. It exceeded my expectation for such a small and seemingly simple camera. The touchscreen is outstanding, easy to operate. My four star rating comes from performance in low light at my niece's wedding reception. I took this camera instead of my NEX-6 because I could slip it into my clutch purse. The photos I took were dark and blocky because I hate using flash. The NEX would have taken much better photos. But for outdoor and underwater photos, I do recommend this camera highly.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Alice O. R. Brito
Reviews.Content: I loved it! I was looking for a small camera, but a good one, and then i found this one! I take it for small travels, and always gets nice pics!

Reviews.Title: Very intuitive interface
Reviews.Author: n3jkk
Reviews.Content: I picked up the camera felt very at ease with the options and operations within a couple of minutes.  I bought the camera for my wife who leads stream and river cleanups for a local watershed group and is VERY hard on cameras.  She also found it very easy to use.  Time will tell of its toughness.  The only concern I have up front is the slide down cover for the lens and flash.  It seems vulnerable to catch or clothing straps and small branches while walking through the marshes and woods.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price!!
Reviews.Author: A. Clark
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! It takes fantastic pictures, is easy to use, and looks both beautiful and sleek.  It takes quick pictures, and the screen quality is the best I've ever had in a digital camera.  Also, the stabilization and lighting quality is much better than I expected for such a fantastic price.  I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME DEAL
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Chang
Reviews.Content: I had the exact same camera but the 2011 version and had it lost at a casino in Las Vegas. I spent $320 on that camera. About a month later I received an email for this camera at 50% off.Great for going to the beach since it is waterproof. Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: do not buy this for beach use
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: Cons:do not buy this for beach use. Mine was dead on the spot.First, it is not sandproof, the sand will stuck the sliding door of the camera. Second, it is not salt water proof.Pros:The picture quality is ok and the shutter lag is not big for the two star rating.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: Jessie Wang
Reviews.Content: needed small point & shoot camera for trip, and this one did a great job, easy to use, long battery life, great picture quality

Reviews.Title: Nice Compact Design, Descent Image Quality, BUT LCD Screen Cracked in my Pocket
Reviews.Author: Deremer Studios "Nate"
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for several months, and while I own a photography studio, because of the portability and waterproof/rugged features, if we were going out with the family and I didn't want to lug around the SLRs, I would pop this in my pocket.  I also have used this on a few shoots that involved in or on water shooting.PROSCompact DesignStylish AppearanceResponsive TouchscreenDescent Low Light Quality (in darker settings the noise compensation loses a lot of detail)Nice Wide Angle on the LensCONSZoom limitedLCD Screen (under touch screen) cracked after being in my pocket and sitting in a chair - minimal pressure against the arm of the chair, and I pulled it out to find the screen cracked and unusable.Will be contacting the manufacturer to see how willing they are to help.  Update soon...

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX20 16.2 MP
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this little camera. I have owned other cyber-shots before and by far this is the best one so far. Taking the camera to the swimming pool and capturing pics and videos in HD of the kids was priceless. Even went underwater taking videos of the kids diving. The video came out perfect in HD. This camera is going everywhere I go. Durable and weather/water proof, this camera is right for me. At $200, you can't go wrong. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for water parks, maybe you should buy an extra battery
Reviews.Author: Oswaldo Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I used the camera in a recent trip which involved water parks and I am delighted with its features. With it was possible to take some pictures (in a subterrain river, for example) and videos (snorkeling) impossible with a normal one.The quality for the pictures is great. Underwater quality is ok.Video stabilization is wonderful. There was this video that I took while on an anfibious car with lots of bumps, and I was sorprised when reviewing the video, almost no shake in it.Pros- Almost worries-freeCons- Removing half star for battery life. I missed afternoon photos on 1 water park.- Removing half star for screen brightness. So dificult to see underwater when recording video.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Li
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera. I had an older version then I bought this one, my only complaint is that the lock on the battery/card cover broke, the camera had less than one year of use, Sony replaced the camera under the extended plan that I bought with the camera. In regards to the pictures I love the colors and the panoramic view is amazing. I would give 5 stars if it wasn't for the cover problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: jazzyMe83
Reviews.Content: Our 5-yr old Sony DSC T10 point-n-shoot died bcos it got dropped a lot of times during vacations and finally got lost for about 1/2 an hour at the beach. We found it but the sand managed to penetrate into the lens casing causing focus to not work. We were looking for the same kinds when this model showed up on Daily Deals on Amazon. We bought it in a heartbeat given how good our last one was. This is the 5th generation of T-series cameras from Sony and we love all the new features this one has including being waterproof!!

Reviews.Title: Follow the instructions
Reviews.Author: SrhW
Reviews.Content: This camera was great for the first few days of my vacation. I took it snorkeling and boating, and it took really fabulous pictures. Overall, it was super easy and fun to use (the different settings and picture effects are really cool), and I was thrilled with my purchase... until the fifth day of my vacation, when I decided to give it a charge.I don't know exactly what went wrong, but after charging the camera with the wall outlet, I thought I'd sealed everything up properly before taking it into the ocean again the next day. Unfortunately, it was dead in my hands when I opened the lens cover. It had been working minutes earlier on the path to the beach, so I know it's the water that did it in. When I opened it later to retrieve my SD card (which was fine, so all my pictures were retrievable), there was water in the camera. I think the problem is that I wasn't 100% meticulous in following the cleaning instructions. The instructions say to clean it within 60 minutes of underwater use, and I wasn't always that careful. There must have been some leftover debris or something, a couple grains of sand or salt that got in the gasket when I opened the cover and prevented a proper seal when I closed it again.Fortunately, since it died within a few days of purchase and I got on the return process ASAP, Amazon provided me with a replacement. I haven't tested the new one underwater yet, so my review isn't as fully informed as it could be, but I can say that I am going to follow the cleaning instructions to the letter the next time I use it underwater. I don't regret the purchase at all. I'd say it's totally worth the price. I'd expect a rugged camera at this price point to be at least a little finicky in terms of its durability.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Chitoranu Doru Bogdan
Reviews.Content: Good camera but she have some problem. The quality of picture when the person you make the picture is moving is not very clare. I can tell you that i use the automatic settings . Maybe with better setting the picture will be better.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Sandra Williams
Reviews.Content: We used this for snorkeling and got some great underwater shots!  It also takes great shots in the pool.  I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Rugged, but doesn't take the best pictures
Reviews.Author: Marcus Censor
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX20 is primarily rugged, and secondarily a camera.I was looking for something I could take with me discreetly and casually that would take better pictures than my iPhone 4s and that I wouldn't have to worry about treating roughly. Unfortunately I found that the TX20's photos were only marginally better than those taken by my iPhone.The user interface is very good, as is the touch screen. It might be a fine camera for those who aren't as picky about photo quality, or who are only looking to score style points.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Ella Aguilar
Reviews.Content: I was so glad I found this camera!! I was on the hunt for a waterproof camera for my upcoming Hawaii trip. I did my research and decided to buy the Nikon shock, water, and freeze proof camera. I though it would be the best one. Once I started to play with the camera and saw the resolution on the pictures I decided that this was not the camera for me. I went back to the computer for research and came across this Sony camera.I had never used a Sony product, I was a bit hesitant to even give the camera a chance. It seemed too fragile to me. Also, I did not believe that a camera this nice could also be waterproof! Well after reading many reviews I decided that this camera was the one. I actually ordered it a week before I left, so it made it just in time! I was so excited to see how good this camera really was and it did not disappoint me!The camera is easy to use. Although, I do have to say that the screen icons are a bit small. Im a petite person so my hands are a bit on the small size and I had some trouble at times but its definitely outweighed by how good the pictures are!!! I had so much fun using this camera. The pictures are crystal clear, even underwater. You will have some blurry pictures here and there (it even states it in the camera manual, only because there may be dirt floating in the water) but for the most part good quality!I would definitely recommend this camera!!! Wonderful pictures! Great Picture Quality! Awesome video! (I used this camera while I was zip lining to take video and pictures!) Waterproof! Easy to use! Convenient!!I could go on!!

Reviews.Title: Cooooooooooool
Reviews.Author: Hyoungbin Lim
Reviews.Content: It is sooooooooooo coooooool!!good size for handling.movie in water pool is also good.I love it very much.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: this is the second one we bought in our house... my father has one and my sister has one too. Great picture quality, simple, waterproof, easy to use, great touch screen...

Reviews.Title: Great little waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: FLGatorengineer
Reviews.Content: It performs well for what it's designed to do. Always remember to check the seals before it takes a dip in the water. Picture quality is really good for a point and shoot. We purchased this to throw in my wife's purse so we don't have to lug around the nikon all the time. I may purchase the marine pack in the future to take it on dives, but for now we just use it snorkeling and on the boat.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed just yet
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: So far the camera has been used one week and it froze up.  Some pictures are wonderful, others are terrible.  An entire night of our vacation photos came out a blur and it was set to the auto and then to the superior auto settings.  Did take some nice photos from a moving car though and several nice panoramas.  The small size makes keeping fingers out of the way difficult and finding the right buttons hard too.  I have not yet used it underwater but am hoping at least this function works well.  I am still trying to give this camera a chance and see if user error is my problem.  I am hoping to have no more problems.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Margaret A Murphy
Reviews.Content: This camera wotks as described. I took it on a cruise and used it to snorkel. The pictures came out great. The panoramic views are beautiful and easy to use. The battery life was more then adequate.

Reviews.Title: Good choice!
Reviews.Author: Otto Silveira
Reviews.Content: Very good choice for a simple point and shoot camera. Simple adjustments and good results! Some adjustments could be simpler, even though a few clicks are enough for most settings.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Monika Kvechova
Reviews.Content: Great camer for great price - a lot of scene possibilities and great design! The camera is not really pink - more like fuchsia.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera for all your adventures.
Reviews.Author: Mike Mags
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for $149 as a gold box deal and after taking this camera with me to Brazil and having time to play with the settings, do some trial and error. I can say this is the best point and shoot camera I have ever used and the pictures look amazing even in low light the flash rarely must be used. My only issue was getting used to positioning my fingers properly so they didn't end up in the picture or pressing the touch screen by accident. Once you get that down you will have a truely excellent experence with this camera. I have yet to take it underwater but I did have it out in the Iguazu Waterfalls where it did get quite wet and it perfomed flawlessly.I have owned a various Panasonic and Samsung cameras in the past and they don't even compare!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Francisco Florez
Reviews.Content: It was a present for my girlfriend, she loved it. We were trying it and everything works right, the screen is very sensitive and the photos are great. I haven't tried it underwater, but since i don't live in usa, i adviced her not to try it.

Reviews.Title: Loved it!
Reviews.Author: Isabel Muna
Reviews.Content: The camera turned out smaller than I thought it would look, but it's okay. I love it! Every picture i've taken with it has turned out to be perfect and absolutely clear. That's all that matters to me, a perfectly clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JNB "v_tach"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera around Christmas for what I think is a great price.  The camera is simple to operate and takes great pictures.  Haven't had it exposed to any serious moisture conditions yet but the doors and gaskets look like they'll hold up well to any unplanned dunks during our summer canoe and kayak trips.

Reviews.Title: califican del producto
Reviews.Author: carlos hidalgo
Reviews.Content: primero ante todos se puede decir que es una buena marca un buen estilo es confortante delicada y facil de usar

Reviews.Title: Light and easy
Reviews.Author: Fernando Mainardi
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to use, very compact and lightweight. Takes amazing pictures and has many amazing resources. A great value for what you got.

Reviews.Title: Just excellent
Reviews.Author: Elfa
Reviews.Content: Certainly worth the money.Finding a small-size waterproof/shockproof camera is certainly a rare find.This one suits the bill. It's very small, so it's convenient to carry anywhere.It already fell a few times from pocket height, and it still survives!And it takes quality pictures. I feel that the pictures I take were taken by a professional. It definitely takes quality shots!

Reviews.Title: Great for quick pictures in wet environments.
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Ward
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a couple of months to take pictures of fish species while working on fishing boats in the Bering Sea. It is easily washed free of any salt spray but I have not used it fully submerged. The picture quality is great and it takes clear pictures in low light and shaky conditions. Its small size means that I can keep it securely out of the way in a pocket instead of taking off all my raingear and trekking inside to fetch it. I gave it four stars though because there doesn't seem to be a way to disable immediate picture review after each shot.

Reviews.Title: buen producto
Reviews.Author: edeciogr
Reviews.Content: El producto llego excelentes condiciones y se entrego en la fecha indicada estoy muy agradecido por la atencion; el producto funciona perfectamente

Reviews.Title: Honestly, the best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Yaya
Reviews.Content: I have owned quite a few cameras over the years, but nothing really blew my mind like this one did.I needed a water proof camera to go on a trip with my family (which included a snorkeling tour) and this happened to be on sale. I didnt do much research, as it was from Sony and I always had a good luck with their products, but it really turned out to be the best camera ever.I took it underwater for hours in the middle of the ocean. It took such clear and amazing pictures underwater, and it functioned perfectly in the ocean (and i forgot to wash it with freshwater afterwards for 2 days, but it still functions perfectly).It is light, compact and sleek which makes it very easy to carry around even in my little purse.Also, unlike some cameras, you dont need to hold down the button - it takes pic when you want it to.It is very quick to adjust itself under it's "auto" mode to take perfect picture with the most appropriate settings. It really works so much better than any other cameras I had.  Very impressed and absolutely loving it.

Reviews.Title: Works Great Underwater
Reviews.Author: noname
Reviews.Content: Works great underwater. Some users had issues with water getting inside the camera while underwater. From my experience, it has not happened so far. Overall it takes great quality pictures and I highly recommend if you are getting a camera for both in and out of the water.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Luiza C.
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera! I would surely recommend it to a friend :) I can't expect to try it under the water!!!

Reviews.Title: INCREIBLE!!!
Reviews.Author: Caro_uio
Reviews.Content: Esta camara es perfect para ir de viaje.... es muy pequeña y liviana, la puedes llevar donde sea en un bolsillo... las fotos son increibles y los videos son HD...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: tatiana
Reviews.Content: Awesome Camera, great quality pictures.!!!!! Its very much worth the price, you would not regret if you will buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: awesome product
Reviews.Author: atticusPMA "andy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my dad for Christmas, and I'm totally jealous. It's an awesome camera, with plenty of functions to mess around with. Though I can't comment on the water proof aspect of this device (simply because I'm nervous to try it), the camera alone makes this a worth while purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent,my wife love it.
Reviews.Author: Arcadio Ruiz
Reviews.Content: Por que cinco estrellas? excelente camara, imagen nitida, es aprueba de agua y tiene la calidad indiscutible de Sony, la recomiendo 100% para todas aquellas personas quieran grabar sus momentos importantes con nitides.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: jstewart201
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my work as I work outside in all kinds of weather and use a camera for my work.  I wanted something that was waterproof for those days when its raining, I don't have to worry that my camera is going to get ruined.  I like this camera, but... what I don't like about it is the touch screen.  I often have to use the camera one handed and boy touch anywhere on the back of this camera and it has a mind of its own.  You have to be very careful not to accidently touch the back of the camera while taking pictures.Picture quality is great.I have not tried it underwater.  Hopefully, I can go snorkeling soon and give it a try.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: neighbor
Reviews.Content: So far so good, takes pictures really fast, so you don't miss moments.  Also takes really nice outdoor video.  I just got it so I will update after I have used it for a while.

Reviews.Title: Lovely little toy for a teenager - or for anybody!
Reviews.Author: Maria, Qatargirl
Reviews.Content: Excellent functions and lovely clear pictures. Our daughter loves it. It seems quite robust too which is a major bonus!

Reviews.Title: DSC-TX20
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera that was waterproof so I could take underwater pictures on our trip to the Dominican Republic.I usually stick with Canon cameras but their waterproof offerings where a little more than I wanted to spend so after a lot of research I decided on the Sony DSC-TX20.Positives:1. Camera is a really small. Fits nicely in your pocket which is a plus while traveling.2. Takes nice pictures and video3. Feels like a quality made camera. Doesn't feel "cheap".4. Takes nice underwater shots and I had no problems with it leaking.5. Battery life seemed really good.Negatives:1. Lense cover can sometimes be hard to slide down.2. Water becomes trapped behind the lense cover so it can take awhile to dry out.3. Sony uses some weird USB cable so if you lose it or forget it you can't charge the camera. Why they don't use a standard micro or mini connector is beyond me. But it is Sony and they are known for this.4. Screen can be a little hard to see in the bright sun.5. I wish the wrist strap was adjustable so you could tighten it so it fit securely on your wrist. This would be a big plus while underwater so it doesn't slip off.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase. It took really nice underwater shots and I actually used it quite a bit around the resort instead of my DSLR Canon.Just a suggestion if you plan on using this camera in salt water. Make sure to rinse it really good with fresh water and let it dry completely before opening it up to charge or take out the memory card. I think that is why some people have had failures with this camera as the salt water eats away at the seals.

Reviews.Title: Up in Smoke.... Literally....
Reviews.Author: Krista
Reviews.Content: Started out great.  I've owned the Canon D10 and an Olympus water camera (that I hate).  We use them for my husbands hiking/snorkeling business in the Caribbean.  I will say we likely use it more then the average user, but we do what we are supposed to in terms of soaking it after use in the salt water, etc.  Off the bat, thrilled with the picture quality and features of the camera, but have had it about 2 months, and when my husband plugged it into the computer the other day it was literally smoking from the connector.... it seems water got in, despite the fact that the seals were all properly in.  I just don't think these cameras are made for daily use, I don't mind blowing a seal after a years worth of work 3 - 4 days a week in the sea, but barely 2 months?  Not good.  I do have the extended warranty that covers everything, but am once again left without a water camera for the business.  Very disappointing.  :(

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: S Douglas
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera when Amazon had this one for a great price I had to get it.And I have to say I love it,the size and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: super sleek
Reviews.Author: fercmal2 "FM2"
Reviews.Content: was surprised to hold the unit after opening the box due to its size. i know its a point & shoot but i never reckoned that it was gonna be this small for a waterproof shockproof unit. i have owned different brands with the same characteristics but this is by far the best in terms of looks. elegant and distinctly suave. have yet to test it underwater and will update my review soon

Reviews.Title: vanessa
Reviews.Author: Guzman Mun 306601 Vanessa
Reviews.Content: muy buena la camara y el envio fue rapido tiene buena imagen  llego en perfectas condiciones . . . .

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Mary F. Kenny
Reviews.Content: Purchased as Chritsmas pressent.  For the sony camera boyfriend wanted this and it is just what he needed for taking kayaking. He loves it easy to use and takes great underwater shots.

Reviews.Title: BEST VACATION SNAP AND SHOOT
Reviews.Author: MiKe i LyHnO
